https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3121.name: Lagavulin 16 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3121.description: The Islay representative in the 'Classic Malts' series is a deep, dry and exceptionally peaty bruiser. Probably the most pungent of all Islay malts, Lagavulin is not for the faint-hearted but inspires fanatical devotion in its many followers.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3453.name: Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3453.description: Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask has been aged in a combination of American oak and ex-sherry casks. This is a rich whisky which combines fruity citrus and caramel with spicy ginger and nutmeg.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1803.name: Yellow Spot 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1803.description: A second entry into the 'Spot' range, aged for 12 years and made up in part from spirit matured in Malaga casks for a sweet and moreish dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2938.name: Hibiki Harmony
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2938.description: Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of Japanese malt and grain whiskies from Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. Presented in the brand's trademark 24-faceted bottle representing the Japanese seasons, this is light, approachable and moreish with enticing notes of orange peel and white chocolate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2377.name: Yamazaki Distiller's Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2377.description: A fresh and fruity whisky from Yamazaki, full of red fruit and a touch of sherry cask. It's also got some mizunara (Japanese oak) matured whisky in the mix, which comes through as a complex spicy and almost incense-like note. A well put together and deep dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3276.name: Yoichi Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3276.description: Relaunched in 2016, this comes from Nikka's excellent Yoichi distillery. This is a blend of single malts from different years and consequently does not carry an age statement. This is a smoky whisky with a maritime character.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2589.name: Compass Box Hedonism
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2589.description: A terrific blended grain whisky (the first of its type when released in 2000) from tireless innovators Compass Box. Supple & silky, with elegant, rich flavours of vanilla, toffee, coconut and cocoa.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.name: Longmorn 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.description: A smooth and juicy Longmorn single malt, matured for 18 years in a combination of American oak barrels and hogsheads before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of sweet pear, ripe mango and creamy toffee mingle with orange marmalade on the nose, complemented by notes of fudge, oak and roasted nuts on the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5072.name: Ledaig 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5072.description: Ledaig 18 Year Old is a fruity, peaty whisky from Tobermory, finished in sherry casks, balancing sweet, floral aromas with rich smoke and sea salt on the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5100.name: Glenallachie 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5100.description: A 15-year-old Glenallachie single malt, matured in a combination of Pedro Ximenez and oloroso sherry casks, creating a smooth, rich character. Aromas of raisins, butterscotch and sweet spices fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, orange peel, banana, raisins and caramel.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/114/.name: Ardbeg Uigeadail
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/114/.description: A fine drop of Ardbeg bottled at cask strength. A marriage of Ardbeg from bourbon barrels and sherry butts which gives a sweet and smoky finish to this malt. Uigeadail is the loch from which all Ardbeg water flows. An absolutely stunning whisky, and following the demise of Airigh nam Beist, this probably represents the best value in the core range.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1362.name: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1362.description: This is the relaunched version of Bunnahabhain 18yo, having ditched the caramel colouring and chill-filtration and upped the strength to 46.3%. A triumph for 'naturalist' whisky drinkers.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5258.name: Aberfeldy 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5258.description: An excellent value 21yo Aberfeldy, showcasing the richer end of the Highland spectrum with plenty of sherry influence.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6576.name: Strathmill 1996
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6576.description: A 1996 Strathmill single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage that was matured in a pair of hogsheads for quarter of a century, before being bottled in January 2022 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2516.name: Glenmorangie Signet
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2516.description: A delicious no-age-statement dram from Glenmorangie, some of the spirit in Signet has been made using a unique heavily roasted chocolate malt that really beefs up the rich flavours. The packaging is impressive, too.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6815.name: Balvenie 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6815.description: A sweet and smoky 17-year-old single malt from Balvenie Stories collection, made during the one week of the year that the distillery uses peated malt. Aromas of sweet peat smoke, butterscotch, delicate flowers and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of oaky vanilla, orange zest, blossom honey, sweet cream and rich, sweet peat smoke throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6682.name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6682.description: A rich sherry-matured 15-year-old single malt from one of the best distilleries in Speyside, Glenfarclas, accompanied by miniature bottles of Glenfarclas 105 and Glenfarclas 25 Year Old.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5861.name: Bowmore 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5861.description: A whisky coming into its prime. This 15-year-old single malt, which spends its final three years in oloroso sherry casks, is elegantly balanced between this sherry influence and the distillery's fruit and peat characteristics – including a siren-like whisper of tropical fruit that will delight fans of older-style Bowmore. Now is the time to try Bowmore 15 Year Old, which reflects the best of the distillery's output from around the new millennium.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2072.name: Glenfarclas 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2072.description: An all-time classic, Glenfarclas 25yo is the epitome of long-aged sherried Speyside, gorgeously smooth and silkily-textured, with rich, generous flavours of fruitcake, hazelnuts, dried fruit and a hint of dark chocolate and coffee. A thoroughly delightful dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5267.name: Ardbeg 1990
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5267.description: Airigh Nam Beist 1990 is a delicious vintage bottling from the ongoing success story that is Ardbeg. Sadly now discontinued due to exhausted stocks, 'the Beist' was an extremely popular Ardbeg, with assertive and powerful peatiness and a lovely honeyed edge. Oh, and it's pronounced 'Arry nam Baysht'.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4640.name: Ardbeg Twenty Something
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4640.description: A third delicious instalment in Ardbeg's Twenty Something series, this 22-year-old is an excellent example of Ardbeg’s rich, smoky character while simultaneously showcasing the distillery’s remarkable talent for producing light, fresh flavours. Matured exclusively in ex-bourbon casks, Ardbeg’s characteristically thick, tarry bassline mingles with vibrant tropical fruit notes, seamlessly-integrated spices and a fresh menthol aroma which melds with peat smoke in the long, breezy finish. At once weighty and playful, this whisky – distilled in 1996 during the distillery’s darkest time – is crafted as testament to the quality and tenacity of Ardbeg spirit. And boy is it tasty.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/20/a.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/20/a.description: Connoisseurs Choice released some phenomenal Ardbegs from the mid-1970s vintages in the mid-to-late 1990s - and they remain the best source for affordable examples of these legendary vintages now that the prices of distillery bottlings have gone into the stratosphere.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1519.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1519.description: One of the first releases by Glenmorangie (who had bought the distillery in 1997), this 1978 vintage was distilled a year after Ardbeg had completely closed their on-site maltings. A sought after bottling that is hard to find nowadays.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/67/a.name: Ardbeg 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/67/a.description: A rare bottle of 10 year old Ardbeg bottled some time in the 1990s. This is especially rare as the distillery was closed for almost the entire preceding decade.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5804.name: Ardbeg 2011
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5804.special: 8 Year Old Cote Rotie Cask #2323 Embassy Exclusive
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5804.description: A 2011 Ardbeg single malt that has been matured exclusively in a single Cote Rotie wine barrique for eight years, before being bottled in July 2020 for the Ardbeg Embassies releases. Aromas of sea salt, medicinal herbs, dark chocolate, water lilies and rich, pungent peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of melted rubber, rich peat, smoked cocoa powder, clove, nutmeg, salted peanuts and hot tar throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5946.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5946.description: A 1975 vintage Ardbeg from independent bottlers Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. Produced in the first year of Ardbeg importing large amounts of malted barley from the mainland, this is a slightly less peatier Ardbeg than one is used to.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1773.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1773.description: A single cask release of 1972 Ardbeg, specially selected for Alambic Classique in Germany. This whisky has been aged for 28 years and bottled by Douglas Laing as part of their Old Malt Cask range.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5949.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5949.description: Bottled in 2006 for the Italian market, this rare Ardbeg 1975 was matured in a single ex-sherry cask.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/76/a.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/76/a.description: A single cask Ardbeg 1972 bottled from a bourbon hogshead for the French market in 2004. This one is a sister cask to the famous VELIER 1972 released the previous year for the Itaolian market, and like its sibling this picked up an amazing 95 points from Serge at Whiskyfun.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/99/a.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/99/a.description: Bottled from a sherry butt for the Japanese market in 2002, this cask-strength dram is from the 1976 batch of sherry casks that took Ardbeg's reputation into the stratosphere.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3680.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3680.description: A 1972 vintage bottling of Ardbeg, bottled by the distillery from cask #2780 in 2004 at 31 years old. These vintage releases remain sought after thanks to them offering a glimpse into the history of the distillery and the incredible whiskies it was making in the 1970s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6274.name: Ardbeg 1979
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6274.description: A 1979 Ardbeg single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for four decades, before being bottled in June 2020 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/95/a.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/95/a.description: A single sherry cask release of Ardbeg 1976 bottled for the Italian market in 2002. Cask 2396 is one of a series of legendary sister sherry casks bottled by Ardbeg in the late 1990s and early 2000s that really cemented the distillery's cult status amongst aficionados.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2308.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2308.description: A rare 1972 vintage Ardbeg produced for Juuls Vinhandel in Denmark. This release is referred to as 'Ping No.1' on the back and was produced for the 30th Business Anniversary of Michael Madsen (one of their workers). A real collector's item.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/117/.name: Ardbeg 1967
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/117/.special: 30 Year Old Dark Oloroso Sherry Cask #578 Signatory
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/117/.description: A very special bottle of 1967 vintage whisky from Ardbeg distillery. This whisky has been matured for 30 years in an Oloroso sherry cask, giving it a beautifully dark colour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/93/a.name: Ardbeg 1976 Manager's Choice
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/93/a.description: The famous Ardbeg 'Manager's Choice' bottling is a single sherry cask from 1976 selected by Stuart Thomson for sale at the distillery in 1999. An enormous hit at the time, this was one of the key early single cask bottlings that kickstarted Ardbeg's stratospheric rise.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/97/a.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/97/a.description: A sherry butt of Ardbeg from the legendary 1976 batch, this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2002.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9441.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9441.description: A legendary vintage release from Ardbeg in the years after they were acquired by Glenmorangie. Matured for 31 years in a sherry butt and bottled at cask strength in 2008.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1084.name: Gold Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1084.description: 44 years of quiet maturation in the famous number one vaults, has allowed an exceptional and rare example of Bowmore single malt to develop – the oldest one ever to be released from the distillery.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7361.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7361.description: Over its many years of distillation, Bowmore has produced some outstanding, iconic limited edition bottlings. This particularly stunning example of Bowmore was distilled on the 5th of November 1964. The spirit was carefully filled into exceptional Oloroso sherry casks then laid down to mature deep in the distillery vaults below sea level.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5798.name: Black Bowmore 1964 Aston Martin DB5
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5798.description: The first-ever collaboration between Bowmore distillery and Aston Martin, Black Bowmore DB5 brings together an iconic single malt and a legendary car. Distilled in 1964, this exceptional whisky is presented in a unique decanter, made with a genuine Aston Martin DB5 piston.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9006.name: White Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9006.description: White Bowmore has been gradually maturing in six bourbon casks

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/923/.name: Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/923/.description: 1964 seems to be something of a miracle vintage for Bowmore - not only did it produce Black Bowmore and the Oddbins Oloroso cask, but also this beautiful Fino sherry expression. Here the peat is restrained and subtle, leaving the way clear for a stunning, incredibly fruity Bowmore that not everyone understood at the time of release, but which has since become a classic. There seems little chance that we will see another example of this style of Bowmore from this era again.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2302.name: Bowmore 1961
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2302.description: An exceptional release from Bowmore – distilled in December 1961, this whisky was aged for 50 years in a pair of ex-bourbon hogsheads. The bottle is hand-blown by Glasstorm, the burr elm display cabinet handcrafted by Peter Toaig and the silver neck stopper and collar fashioned by Thomas Fattorini. An incredible Islay malt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5204.name: Bowmore 1965
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5204.description: A legendary limited-edition Bowmore single malt, distilled in 1965 and matured in a single oloroso sherry cask for more than half a century, before being bottled at cask strength. Fragrant fruits, bees wax and dark chocolate fill the nose, alongside aromas of jasmine, raisins and apricots.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2262.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2262.description: The first edition of the legendary Black Bowmore - distilled in 1964 and matured in oloroso casks for 29 years before being unleashed on the world.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/921/.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/921/.description: The second of the three extraordinary Oloroso cask 1964 Bowmores released in the mid-1990s. Like the first batch, this release was of 2000 bottles, and originally retailed on the high street for around £80(!). A much higher proportion of casks filled in the 1960s were sherry, and Black Bowmore is proof of the quality of some of those casks. With an almost unfathomable concentration and intensity of flavour, and perfect balance of fruit, peat and power, this whisky deserves the frequently overused 'legendary' tag and has assumed almost mythic status amongst whisky collectors and aficionados.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.description: This is the American edition of the third of the three extraordinary Oloroso cask 1964 Bowmores released in the mid-1990s. With an almost unfathomable concentration and intensity of flavour, and with the perfect balance of fruit, peat and power, Black Bowmore deserves the frequently overused 'legendary' tag and have assumed mythic status.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.description: The second of the three extraordinary Oloroso cask 1964 Bowmores released in the mid-1990s. Like the first batch, this release was of 2000 bottles, and originally retailed on the high street for around £80(!). A much higher proportion of casks filled in the 1960s were sherry, and Black Bowmore is proof of the quality of some of those casks. With an almost unfathomable concentration and intensity of flavour, and perfect balance of fruit, peat and power, this whisky deserves the frequently overused 'legendary' tag and has assumed almost mythic status amongst whisky collectors and aficionados.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/922/.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/922/.description: The third of the three extraordinary Oloroso cask 1964 Bowmores released in the mid-1990s, this final batch was of 1812 bottles. With an almost unfathomable concentration and intensity of flavour, and with the perfect balance of fruit, peat and power, this whisky deserves the frequently overused 'legendary' tag and has assumed almost mythic status amongst whisky collectors and aficionados. While the First Edition Black Bowmore is generally agreed to be slightly more magnificent than the 2nd or 3rd, it is really a case of 'first among equals'. Certainly the differences between Second and Third are differences only of emphasis and nuances of flavour, and are really only noticeable when they are tasted side by side (which few of us mere mortals will ever manage).

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2361.name: Black Bowmore 1964
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2361.description: The first edition of the legendary Black Bowmore - distilled in 1964 and matured in oloroso casks for 29 years before being unleashed on the world. Only 2000 bottles of this were released and there are only few of them left in the wild......

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2263.name: Bowmore 1956
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2263.description: A beautiful 1956 vintage Bowmore, distilled before the Morrisons took over the business but bottled rather elegantly by them. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s. Please note: this bottle contains sediment.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1114.name: Bowmore 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1114.description: An very rare old Bowmore 18yo from the 1960s in an unusual pear-shaped bottle. The original plastic seal was broken and coming off, we replaced it with a new clear plastic seal.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/918/.name: Bowmore 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/918/.description: A 30 year old Bowmore bottled in 1963, the year that Stanley Morrison bought the company, and released as a celebration of the 30th year of his ownership.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2535.name: Bowmore 1957
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2535.description: An incredible whisky from Bowmore, this was distilled in 1957 and aged for 38 long years before being bottled in the mid 1990s. A legendary bottling which received 93 points from Serge over on whiskyfun.com.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/972/.name: Bowmore 1965
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/972/.description: A 22 year old release of 1965 vintage Bowmore bottled for Edinburgh's Prestonfield hotel. They've certainly got good taste, as these mid-60s Bowmores are well known for being excellent.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/964/.name: Bowmore Bicentenary
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/964/.description: A very rare bicentenary whisky from Bowmore, bottled at cask strength in 1979 as part of the 200th birthday celebrations. This edition was produced for the Italian market and comes in a rather unusual square bottle. The whisky is reputed to have been distilled in 1969, but does not say so on the bottle.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2309.name: Bowmore 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2309.description: A 1963 vintage Bowmore, bottled at 30 years of age. Distilled in the year that Stanley Morrison bought the company, and released as a celebration of the 30th year of his ownership.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/892/.name: Bowmore 1966
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/892/.description: A Hart Brothers bottling of Bowmore distilled in 1966, one of the legendary years of production for the distillery. It was bottled 34 years later at a cask strength of 42.6%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5950.name: Ardbeg 1998
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5950.description: Following on from Very Young and Still Young, Ardbeg Almost There showed the final stage in the evolution of young cask-strength Ardbeg 1998 before it blossomed into the Renaissance 10 yr-old. As you would expect, this is a mellower, more rounded, better balanced dram than the younger incarnations.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4586.name: Ardbeg 18 Years Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4586.description: A special 10th-Anniversary bottling, celebrating the Whisky Show's big birthday. It's rare to see indie-bottled Ardbeg and this went down a treat at the show, with its big smoke, barbecue sauce and beach bonfire character giving peat heads exactly what they were after.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5532.name: Ardbeg 2000
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5532.description: A very special bottling of Ardbeg, released to celebrate the theme of Whisky Show 2020 - Whisky: an ever-changing world. This 2000-vintage Ardbeg represents the ever-changing world of order: humans and machines working together to craft excellent whisky. Every bottle features a different label, with each individual label taken from a larger picture designed by The Whisky Exchange creative director Raj 'Mr C' Chavda - if you own a bottle, follow the link on the back to claim your label.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5071.name: Ardbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5071.description: Inspired by Islay's Traig Bhan - known to locals as the Singing Sands - a beautiful beach with soft white sands, said to sing beneath your feet. A velvety-smooth single malt, Traig Bhan offers aromas of salty, smoky bonfires on the beach, sweet pineapple and burnt caramel. The palate offers notes of paprika, smoky chilli chocolate and aromatic wood smoke.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/16/a.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/16/a.description: An old Connoisseur's Choice bottling of Ardbeg 1975, distilled in the middle of the distillery's golden era, shortly before the removal of the floor maltings, and bottled in 1997.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/101/.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/101/.description: The third of the limited edition vintage releases of distillery-bottled Ardbeg 1978, this is from 1999.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1498.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1498.description: A 1975 vintage whisky from Ardbeg Distillery. This was bottled in 1998, which is the same year that the Ardbeg Vistor Centre was reopened.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/112/.name: Ardbeg Committee Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/112/.description: An exclusive release for the Ardbeg Committee, the distillery's fan club, bottled in 2002 with no age statement. It's made up of whiskies from the 70s, 80s and 90s and was bottled at full-proof of 55.3%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/11/a.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/11/a.description: A 21 year old independent bottling of Ardbeg distilled shortly before they closed their onsite maltings.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5724.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5724.description: A 1975 vintage Ardbeg from Douglas Laing as part of their Platinum Selection series. This was the first year of Ardbeg using large amounts of barley malted off site. Aged for 30 years in wood, this is complex with a classic salinity.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1411.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1411.description: A very rare Ardbeg 1972 bottled over a decade ago as a 28 year-old for Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2913.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2913.description: An old single-cask Ardbeg 1972 bottled from a bourbon hogshead for the German market. This is from a batch of famous bourbon casks bottled for various markets in 2004 which met with critical acclaim.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3288.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3288.special: Cask 4704 Oloroso Sherry Cask Islay Festival Signed
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3288.description: An ex-oloroso sherry cask of Ardbeg from 1975, this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2005.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/75/a.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/75/a.description: A cask-strength Ardbeg from the hugely desirable 1972 vintage, bottled from a single bourbon cask for Oddbins in 2004. Even that far back, Ardbeg mania was already in full effect - this bottling was said to have sold out in under two hours, and that was even before whisky guru Serge of Whiskyfun had given it 93 points...

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/98/a.name: Ardbeg 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/98/a.description: An sherry butt of Ardbeg from the legendary 1976 batch, this rare Ardbeg was bottled for the Feis Ile in 2004.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6509.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6509.description: An old single cask Ardbeg bottled from a bourbon hogshead for the Belgian market in 2004.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/74/a.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/74/a.description: An old single cask Ardbeg 1972 bottled in 2003 for the Italian market in 2003. This was perfectly described as an 'old glory' by Whiskyfun's Serge Valentin, who gave it 95 points.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1997.name: Glenfarclas 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1997.description: A 1963 vintage entry in Glenfarclas's Family Casks range, part of the 10th release of single cask bottlings. Bottled in 2012 it's a rich old traditional whisky from the distillery, packed full of sherry fruit.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1773.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1773.description: A single cask whisky from Ardbeg Distillery. This whisky was distilled in 1975 and aged for 24 years. Bottled at Douglas Laing's preferred strength of 50% and as part of their Old Malt Cask range.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/30/a.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/30/a.description: A single cask bottling of Ardbeg whisky, distilled in 1972 and aged for 29 years. This whisky has undergone a finishing process of a minimum of 6 months in a sherry cask, before being bottled at Douglas Laing's preferred strength of 50%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7443.name: Ardbeg 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7443.description: A cask-strength release of Ardbeg 1975 bottled in 2006 from a single sherry cask for sale. There are now almost no sherry casks from the 1970s left at Ardbeg for this kind of bottling.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1774.name: Ardbeg 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1774.description: An old single cask release of 1972 whisky from Ardbeg Distillery. Bottled by Douglas Laing at the age of 28 years, for their Old Malt Cask range.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/31/a.name: Ardbeg 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/31/a.description: A single cask whisky from Ardbeg distillery. Distilled in 1973 and aged for 27 years. Bottled by Douglas Laing, without colouring or chill-filtration, for their Old Malt Cask range.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4033.name: Benriach 42 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4033.description: A single-cask Benriach 42 Year Old, bottled to celebrate The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show: Old & Rare 2018. The whisky has juicy notes of tropical fruit, accompanied by sweet spice, mint and vanilla cream.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1717.name: Benriach 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1717.description: A 25 year old from Speyside's Benriach, made using their peated spirit and sat at the top end of the age range for their peated whisky. This is the follow-up to the much-vaunted Authenticus 21yo and is claimed by the producers to show herb, honey and tropical fruit flavours alongside the smoke.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4149.name: Benriach 30 Year Old Authenticus Peated
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4149.description: Following on from the 21 Year Old and 25 Year Old Authenticus, BenRiach have now added this impressive 30 Year Old to the series. Expect a very intense Speyside malt with notes of wild honey and peat on the nose, creamy vanilla, summer fruits and slight hint of cocoa on the palate, all infused sweet peat on the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4189.name: Benriach 1966 Set With Glass & Miniature
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4189.description: A cracking old bottling of Benriach, released by Signatory Vintage back in July 2001. It's one of their special sets including a tasting glass and a miniature, giving you a chance to have a taste before you open the whole bottle. This is a classic Benriach of the era, with stacks of fruit.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6035.name: Benriach The Twenty Five
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6035.description: A mellow, smoky 25-year-old single malt from Benriach, made with a combination of peated and un-peated spirit and matured in a combination of sherry casks, bourbon barrels, virgin oak casks and Madeira Island wine casks. The result is aromas of smoked apricots, dark chocolate covered cherries and hazelnut toffee that fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apples, cinnamon, toasted oak, orange and smoky caramel throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2492.name: Benriach 1969
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2492.description: A bottle of 1969 vintage Benriach, bottled by Gordon & Macphail as part of their Connoisseurs Choice series of bottlings, complete with the classic map label. We estimate this dates from the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5977.name: Benriach 40 Year Old + Hip Flask & Miniature
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5977.description: Appearing at the beginning of 2007, this is likely to be mostly comprised of the phenomenal malts that were being produced by BenRiach in the mid-1960s. These whiskies have gained an incredible tropical fruitiness over time and also benefit from a rich layer of chewy peat. An absolutely delicious, rich, textured malt, and beautifully presented with a pewter hipflask.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4456.name: Benriach 28 Years Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4456.description: A fresh and fruity dram bottled specially for The Whisky Exchange Whisky Show's 10th Anniversary. Benriach is known for its fruity spirit, and it's developed over 28 years to become a fruit-bomb of a dram, with lashings of tropical and citrus fruit backed up by biscuity malt and victoria sponge.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2729.name: Benriach 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2729.description: A 25-year-old release from Benriach made from a combination of whisky finished in new wood and sherry butts. This has been bottled for the export market at 46.8%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6391.name: Benriach 2000
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6391.description: A 2000 Benriach single malt from Belgian bottler The Nectar, matured for 21 years before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Daily Drams series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.name: Benriach 2000
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.description: A 2000 Benriach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage that has been matured in a first-fill sherry butt for 22 years, before being bottled in July 2022 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6176.name: Bunnahabhain 2001
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6176.special: 19 Year Old Sherry Cask The Whisky Show 2021
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6176.description: A 2001 Bunnahabhain single malt from Whisky Show 2021 that shows off the distillery's fruitier side. Aromas of forest floor, raisins, toffee apples and apple crumble, vanilla custard and malt loaf fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, heavily-spiced fruit cake, buttery nutmeg, hot cinnamon and cake batter throughout the palate, with apple puree, toasted rye bread and custard lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.name: Caol Ila 2010
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.description: A 2010 Caol Ila single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage that was matured in a single cask for 11 years, before being bottled in July 2022 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.name: Bunnahabhain 2012
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6799.description: A 2012 Bunnahabhain single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage that has been matured in a first-fill sherry butt for a decade, before being bottled in June 2022 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4823.name: Ichiro's Malt & Grain World Blended Whisky
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4823.description: A blend from the king of independent Japanese distillers, Ichiro Akuto. In addition to whisky from his own Chichibu distillery, it also includes whiskies from America, Canada, Scotland and Ireland. As it says on the label – 'This is worldwide blended whisky'.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4122.name: George Dickel 9 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4122.description: This whiskey is from George Dickel's private cask programme, which bottles individual barrels of nine-year-old and 14-year-old for individuals. Each bottle is hand labelled and signed by George Dickel's master distiller.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3512.name: Macallan 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3512.description: Deliciously smooth, with rich dried fruits and sherry, balanced with woodsmoke and spice. Described by F Paul Pacult, the renowned international whisky writer, in his book Kindred Spirits as 'simply the best 12 Year Old single malt around'.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6942.name: Highland Park 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6942.description: The 2017 relaunch of one of our all-time favourites, this has to be one of the most consistently excellent malt whiskies of the past 10 years. Showered with awards and praise from all quarters, it was named as 'Best Spirit in the World' by F Paul Pacult of the Spirit Journal. Unfailingly excellent, especially after a good meal.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.name: Caperdonich 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.description: A zesty, sweet single malt from Capedronich, matured in barrels for 21 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of orange zest, lemon curd and barley sugar fill the nose, complemented by notes of poached pear, creamy vanilla and summer blossoms throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2695.name: Lagavulin 1995 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2695.description: Lagavulin's popular limited edition Distiller's Edition, distilled in 1995, finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks, and bottled in 2013. An extra layer of sweetness soothes the rough edges of this much-loved dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.name: Edradour 1999
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.description: A 1999 Edradour single malt that has been matured for 22 years and bottled in 2021 after a period finishing in ex-oloroso sherry casks. Aromas of black cherries, baking spice and roasted nuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of milk chocolate, raisins, ice cream, Christmas cake and toasted oak throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5114.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost and Rare
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5114.description: The 2019 addition to Johnnie Walker's Ghost and Rare series focusses on the spirit and character of closed distillery Glenury Royal. Combining grain whisky from Cameronbridge distillery with rare single malts from Glen Elgin, Inchgower and Glenkinchie, Ghost and Rare balances Glenury Royal's fruity, sweet notes of apple and apricot with dark fruits, bitter chocolate and nuts, as well as creamy toffee and butterscotch flavours from the grain whiskies.

attributes.distiller: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost and Rare / Glenury Royal']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6632.name: Compass Box The Circle
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6632.description: A fruity limited-edition blended whisky from Compass Box that is made in collaboration with the 2019 The Circle international bartender competition winner Mannie Monaghan and inspired by his synaesthesia – the phenomenon of experiencing joined or coupled sensations, for example hearing shapes or tasting colours. A combination of malt and grain whiskies matured in a variety of casks, including sherry butts, refill hogsheads and refill puncheons, it offers aromas of pineapple and stewed peaches on the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, honey and Cognac-soaked sultanas throughout the palate. For Mannie, this whisky tastes of the colour coral.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6706.name: Edradour 1999
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6706.description: A 1999 Edradour single malt that was initially matured in ex-bourbon hogsheads for 13 years, before being recasked into a pair Bordeaux hogsheads and bottled in April 2022. Aromas of barley sugars, orange and jelly beans fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey cornflakes, candied orange peel, Turkish delight, white pepper and barley sugar throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6623.name: Glenfiddich 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6623.description: A rich and fruity limited-edition single malt from Glenfiddich, Suspended Time was matured in a combination of European and American oak for three decades before being bottled as part of the Re-Imagination of Time series. Aromas of oak spice, dried fruit, toasted walnuts and soft baking spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of heather honey, rose petals, dates, mature oak and dried figs throughout the palate. This bottle is presented in a contemporary decanter and modernist display case that gives the illusion that it is suspended in mid-air.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3007.name: Glenlivet 16 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3007.description: Part of a series of single cask whiskies released to celebrate the spectacular landscape around Glenlivet, Ladderfoot is a sherry-matured 16-year-old single malt with rich notes of ginger, raisins, cinnamon, victoria plum and dark chocolate layered on top of Glenlivet’s classic orchard fruit and toffee character.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5617.name: Ardbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5617.description: The second batch of Arbeg Traigh Bhan 19 Year Old, released in September 2020, is a single batch whisky that offers aromas of sweet wood smoke, vegetal fennel, tea leaves, charcoal and toast on the nose. The palate offers notes of salty peanuts, medicinal smoke, lime juice, smoked pineapple, aniseed, tar and peat smoke that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5642.name: Bunnahabhain Moine 1997
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5642.description: A smoky 1997 Bunnahabhain single malt, matured in a single Pedro Ximenez cask until it was bottled in January 2020. The result is aromas of toffee, dried fruits, roasted nuts and chocolate on the nose, complemented by notes of raisins, sultanas, honeyed dates, coffee and salted caramel chocolate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5138.name: Balvenie Tun 1509
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5138.description: Batch six of Balvenie's Tun 1509 series is a marriage of 21 casks, including refill sherry butts, ex-bourbon barrels and barrels previously used to finish Balvenie Double Wood, chosen by Malt Master David Stewart MBE. Each of these casks has been married in the Tun, which sits in warehouse 24, for three months before being bottled at the distillery. Rich aromas of soft brown sugar, toffee, blossom honey and ginger fill the nose, complimenting notes of maple syrup, candied orange, runny honey, vanilla and oak spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2356.name: Balvenie Founder's Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2356.description: An old bottle of Balvenie Founder's Reserve. This particular range has been discontinued for sometime now, and is becoming a bit of a collectors item. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/305/.name: Balvenie Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/305/.description: A flat bottle of Balvenie Classic from the 1980s, with a wax seal at the base of the neck embossed with the year that they started building the distillery - 1892.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2305.name: Balvenie 18 Year Old Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2305.description: An unboxed flat bottle of Balvenie Classic from the 1980s. This bottling states its age of 18 years on the wax seal at the base of the neck. This is one of the rarer versions of these very collectable Balvenies.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2127.name: William Grant & Sons
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2127.description: A rare release of Balvenie that was intended for William Grant & Sons' staff. The label lists the values that are integral to the company's success.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2038.name: Balvenie Tun 1401
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2038.description: The June 2013 release of Balvenie's Tun 1401, batch 8 is for the UK, European and Australasian markets. Named for Malt Master David Stewart's favourite marrying vat, it's a very limited edition vatting of 9 American Oak and 3 European Oak casks, with an outturn of just 2700 bottles.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1566.name: Balvenie Tun 1401
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1566.description: The long awaited follow up to the distillery only first batch, Tun 1401 Batch 2 is named for Malt Master David Stewart's favourite marrying tun, used to create this whisky. It's a multi-vintage combination of sherry and bourbon cask whiskies from the late 1960s through to the late 1980s and elegantly blends age and (comparative) youthful vigour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3696.name: Balvenie 1966
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3696.description: A 1966-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for more than 30 years in cask 1896, this was one of 204 bottled on November 20 1997.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6498.name: Balvenie 40 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6498.description: A 40-year-old single malt from Balvenie's Rare Marriages series, matured for four decades in a combination of American and European oak casks. Aromas of honey, orange marmalade and creamy fruit fill the nose, complemented by notes of candied ginger, honey, oak, vanilla, orange blossom and sherry-soaked fruit throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4574.name: Balvenie 1968
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4574.description: A 1968-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 32 years in cask 7295, this was one of 180 bottled on September 19 2000.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5216.name: Balvenie 50 Year Old Batch 2
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5216.description: The second batch of The Balvenie 50 Year Old is a marriage of five hand-selected casks, each aged for at least half a century. This whisky is presented in a stunning wooden display box.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2135.name: Balvenie 1968
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2135.description: A very rare, single-cask release of Balvenie, one of the few bottled by the distillery themselves. This was launched in late 2000 and showcases Balvenie's incredible 1960s' distillate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3494.name: Balvenie 1951
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3494.description: A rare single cask of 1951 Balvenie. Aged for 45 years before being bottled in 1996. Only 90 bottles were produced and this is a true collector's item.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/295/.name: Balvenie 1968
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/295/.description: A rare bottle of 1968 vintage Balvenie, bottled in 2000. Only 180 bottles ever existed of this, another delicious Balvenie with notes of nuts and citrus. This received 92 points over on whiskyfun.com from Serge Valentin.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6645.name: Balvenie 1970
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6645.description: A very limited bottling from Balvenie of the 1970 vintage, bottled at cask strength from a single sherry cask. Just 191 bottles of this wonderfully dark single malt were released.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5247.name: Balvenie DCS Compendium Chapter 5 1962-2002
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5247.description: The fifth Chapter in Balvenie's DCS Compendium is a selection of casks that represent David Stewart's time in the industry and reflect his skill in choosing casks destined for greatness. These five single malts represent some of the milestone years throughout David's career, including a Fino sherry cask from 2001 and a 1962-vintage single malt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2385.name: Balvenie 1970
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2385.description: A 1970 vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 30 years in cask 12524, this was one of 320 bottled on June 28 2001.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4779.name: Balvenie 1967
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4779.description: A 1967-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 32 years in cask 9914, this was one of 171 bottled on January 27 2000.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/296/.name: Balvenie 1970
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/296/.description: An old release from the Balvenie Vintage Cask series of whiskies. This 1970 whisky has been matured for 30 years and is one of only 320 bottles of this single cask release.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4933.name: Balvenie 1967
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4933.description: A 1967-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for 32 years in cask 9908, this was one of 120 bottled on October 4 1999.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4932.name: Balvenie 1966
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4932.description: A 1966-vintage Balvenie released as part of their Vintage Cask series. Matured for more than 30 years in cask 1897, this was one of 216 bottled on November 20 1997.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2416.name: Balvenie Tun 1401
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2416.description: The third batch of Balvenie's increasingly legendary Tun 1401 series. This was the first US release was comprised of ten casks (seven hogsheads and three sherry butts).

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1759.name: Balvenie Tun 1401
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1759.description: The fifth batch of Balvenie's increasingly legendary Tun 1401 series. This is the second UK/European batch since it became wider released than just as a distillery bottling and its nine constituent casks (4 sherry butts, 3 bourbon hogsheads and 2 bourbon barrels) range in vintage from 1991 back to 1966. A beautiful dram that we expect to fly.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6412.name: Balvenie 30 Year Old Rare Marriages
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6412.description: A 30-year-old single malt from Balvenie's Rare Marriages range that has been matured in a combination of different casks, creating a complex, sweet character. Aromas of honey, oak and candied orange peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, plum, marzipan, caramelised pears and gentle spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7214.name: Balvenie 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7214.description: This 17yo Sherry Oak Balvenie is an unusual expression as most Balvenie has a significant proportion of American oak in the mix.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4426.name: Glenlivet 1981
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4426.special: 36 Year Old Sherry Finish TWE Exclusive
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4426.description: Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange, this hand-picked, single cask 36 year-old is a colossus of long-aged Glenlivet complexity, having spent its final 6 years in a sherry butt. The nose is an alluring, aromatic maze of cocoa, dried fruit, pastry and subtle oak. It’s just as enchanting on the tongue, where fresh apple and cinder toffee battle spice for dominance of a tempered citrus and oak landscape. All is reconciled in a finish full of gentle liquorice and mild cinnamon, with more rich, dark fruit to walk us out.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3881.name: Glen Moray Mastery 120th Anniversary
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3881.description: Mastery is a commemorative release of Glen Moray to celebrate the distillery's 120th anniversary. A blend of five vintages, the oldest of which is 1978, matured in a combination of sherry, port and Madeira casks, this is rich with notes of chocolate, coffee and vanilla.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1546.name: Glen Moray 1971
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1546.description: A 1971 vintage Glen Moray, bottled by the distillery in 1999 after 28 years in wood.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2246.name: Glen Moray 1960
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2246.description: A specially selected long-aged Glen Moray from the 1960 vintage, bottled in the late 1980s at 26 years old.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2558.name: Glen Moray 1981
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2558.description: Amazing colour on this 19-year-old Glen Moray 1981, bottled in 2001 at full strength from a single sherry butt selected by distillery manager Edwin Dodson.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1274.name: Glen Moray 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1274.special: 25 Year Old Bottled for Air Nippon
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1274.description: A very special limited edition of Glen Moray 1963, bottled at 25 years old for Japanese airline Air Nippon.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2549.name: Glen Moray 1959
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2549.description: A specially selected long-aged Glen Moray from the 1959 vintage, bottled after 40 years maturation in February 1999. The label states that, at the time of release, this was the oldest and rarest malt ever bottled by the distillery.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1546.name: Glen Moray-Glenlivet 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1546.description: A 1973 vintage Glen Moray, bottled in the early 1990s after 18 years of maturation.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6038.name: Glen Moray 1991
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6038.description: A 1991 Glen Moray single malt from independent bottler The Nectar, matured for almost three decades before being bottled as part of the 15th anniversary release of its Daily Drams series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6603.name: Glen Moray 1990
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6603.description: A 1990 Glen Moray single malt from independent bottler Blackadder that was matured in a single barrel for 31 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Raw Cask Statement series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2559.name: Glen Moray 1991
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2559.description: A 1991 vintage Glen Moray. This was a marriage of casks matured in first-fill mountain oak casks from North America, both toasted and charred versions. This is sweeter than usual expressions from this distillery.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2540.name: Glen Moray 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2540.description: A lovely old 1970s bottle of Glen Moray 10 year old.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6703.name: Glen Moray 1991
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6703.special: Mountain Oak Malt The Final Release

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2543.name: Glen Moray 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2543.special: Bot.1980s The Argyll And Sutherland Highlanders

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5730.name: Glen Moray 1996
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5730.description: A 1996 Glen Moray single malt from indie bottler Asta Morris, matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 23 years, before being bottled in 2019. Aromas of red fruits, sweet spice and peppery oak fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2542.name: Glen Moray 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2542.description: A 12 year old whisky from Speyside's Glen Moray, bottled sometime in the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4045.name: Old Pulteney 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4045.description: Introduced in October 2017, this 25 Year Old single malt is one of the replacements for Old Pulteney's 17-year-old and 21-year-old bottlings. It's a very good one, too: this dram features mature and fragrant notes ranging from dark chocolate and heavy spice to lime honey, baked apples and orange peel.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4326.name: Old Pulteney 1985
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4326.description: A very limited edition exclusive single-cask whisky from Old Pulteney, original bottled for the World of Whiskies travel retail shop at Edinburgh airport. Distilled in 1985 and matured for a whopping 32 years in an American-oak ex-bourbon cask, it was launched on 14 September 2017 and sold out quickly. It's an excellent example of well-aged Pulteney, with a hint of the distillery's maritime character balanced against honeycomb, floral notes and a touch of chocolate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4560.name: Old Pulteney 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4560.description: New for 2018, Old Pulteney's 18 Year Old is aged in both ex-bourbon and Spanish oak casks. This is an intense and warming incarnation of the beloved maritime malt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7218.name: Dalmore 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7218.description: A favourite expression in the Dalmore stable, this 15-year-old is elegant and smooth, with lipsmacking texture and the flawless balance one would expect from blending maestro Richard Paterson.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6230.name: Dalmore 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6230.description: An old bottling of Dalmore 12 year old whisky. This appears to have been bottled sometime in the 1980s, before they switched to their current 'dumpy' bottles.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6593.name: Dalmore 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6593.description: The 2022-release of The Dalmore 21 Year Old was initially matured in American oak casks and finished in first-fill Matusalem oloroso sherry butts from Gonzalez Byass, creating layers of rich fruit and warm spices throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4937.name: Ardbeg Drum
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4937.description: This limited-edition single malt from Ardbeg distillery – Drum – was released for Ardbeg Day, during Feis Ile 2019. Matured in ex-bourbon casks and rested in ex-rum casks, this is a funky, flamboyant whisky. The nose is full of ripe banana, pineapple, cocoa and woodsmoke aromas, with hints of fresh ginger, cinnamon and lavender developing slowly. The palate offers notes of black pepper, ginger, clove and liquorice, alongside dark chocolate, rich smoke and vanilla. An intensely smoky, fruity dram, Ardbeg Drum is the perfect way to celebrate Feis Ile.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2161.name: Glengoyne 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2161.description: Glengoyne 21yo is noticeably deeper than younger expressions, with delicious rich, fruity and oaky notes – the darker colour and long finish are testament to the extra years in the sherry wood.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4560.name: Glenrothes 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4560.description: Matured in sherry casks, the majority of which were first-fill, this is a sweet and spicy whisky with notes of vanilla, fresh ginger and pear.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2415.name: Nikka Coffey Malt Whisky
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2415.description: Previously only released as part of single casks, Nikka decided to add their Coffey Malt to their core range in 2014. Distilled in a Coffey still normally used for grain whisky production, the malt is delightfully fruity and spicy.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5144.name: Glenfiddich 23 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5144.description: Matured in a small number of ex-sherry casks and American oak casks, Glenfiddich Grand Cru has been finished for four months in a combination of first-fill and second-fill French oak casks that have been used to ferment wine that will eventually become a famous sparkling wine. The palate offers notes of creamy vanilla, brioche, pear sorbet and white grapes, complimented by aromas of freshly-baked bread, apple blossom and lemons.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6791.name: Glenburgie 1995
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6791.special: 26 Year Old Sherry Cask Connoisseurs Choice
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6791.description: A 1995 Glenburgie single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail that was matured in a first-fill sherry puncheon for more than quarter of a century, before being bottled in April 2022 as part of its Connoisseurs Choice series. Aromas of stewed raisins, orange peel, fruit cake, milk chocolate, cinnamon and grapefruit fill the nose, complemented by notes of sultanas, figs, black pepper, toasted hazelnut, baked apple and orange zest throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.name: Benriach 2000
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.description: A 2000 Benriach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single ex-sherry cask for 21 years, before being bottled in August 2021 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6577.name: Cameronbridge 1984
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6577.description: A 1984 Cameronbridge single grain whisky from indie bottler Signatory Vintage that was matured in a single refill hogshead for 37 years, before being bottled in January 2022 as part of its Cask Strength Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5810.name: Cameronbridge 1991
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5810.description: A 1991 Cameronbridge single grain whisky from indie bottler Hunter Laing, matured in a single refill butt for 26 years, before being bottled in February 2018 as part of its Sovereign series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6582.name: Langatun 2013 Chateau Kefraya Finish
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6582.description: A limited-edition Swiss single malt from Langatun's Cask Finish series that was initially matured in a French oak ex-Chardonnay cask, before being finished in an ex-Chateau Kefraya red wine cask for two years. Aromas of ripe apricot, salted caramel, crème brûlée, dried figs, cinnamon, clove, milk chocolate and marzipan fill the nose, complemented by notes of prunes, dried figs, liquorice, pink peppercorns, wine gums, roasted almonds, nutmeg and dried apricots throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6821.name: Oxford Rye Whisky 2017
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6821.description: A limited-edition English rye whisky from Oxford Artisan Distillery that is made with heritage grains, grown near the distillery, and was initially matured in American oak casks, before being finished in rare Moscatel Roxo casks from Setúbal, Portugal. Moscatel Roxo, or Purple Moscatel, is a grape variety that was almost completely wiped out when the risk of phylloxera caused winemakers to cease planting its delicate vines. Aromas of honeysuckle, blackberries, plums, peaches, raisins, buttery pastry, flapjacks, almond and hazelnut fill the nose, complemented by notes of hazelnut milk chocolate, sweet grapes, mint, spicy pepper, sourdough and pain aux raisins throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6821.name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Cask Strength
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6821.description: The second release of this full-strength Islay whisky was matured in a combination of first and second fill oloroso sherry casks. The result is an excellent example of Bunnahabhain’s rich, unpeated style packed with chocolate orange, dried fruit and baking spices. A little sea salt cuts through the sweeter notes nicely, leading into a long finish with black pepper and vanilla.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6828.name: Glen Scotia 12 Year Old Seasonal Release
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6828.description: A toast to the tight-knit Campbeltown community, the 2022 Glen Scotia Seasonal Release is an unpeated 12-year-old that was initially matured in first-fill bourbon barrels and finished in Amontillado sherry casks for a final 12 months before bottling. Aromas of salty sea-spray, honey and caramel fill the nose, followed by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, salted caramel and creamy vanilla on the palate and lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5047.name: Ichiro's Malt Double Distilleries 2021
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5047.description: Ichiro's Malt Double Distilleries 2021 is a Japanese blended malt whisky, born from a collaboration between Chichibu and Komagatake distilleries. Matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, American white oak and ex-sherry casks, it holds aromas of caramel, old books, mango, pineapple and orange that fill the nose, complemented by notes of banana, pineapple, mango, sea salt and vanilla throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2940.name: Yamazaki 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2940.description: One of the first Japanese single malts to break into the UK market, Suntory's Yamazaki 12 Year Old continues to impress with its well-balanced fruity sweetness, something that appeals to novice and experienced whisky drinkers alike.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5654.name: Octomore 2009
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5654.description: The fourth edition of the much sought-after Octomore 10 Year Old, this time distilled back in 2009. Peated to an impressive 208ppm, it was aged in a mix of first- and second-fill American oak, and virgin oak casks, and has been bottled at cask-strength with no chill-filtration or added colour. It's a comparatively elegant Octomore, with 10 years in wood rounding the edges off the fearsomely smoky spirit, and exposing its gentler – but still intense – side.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4876.name: Balblair 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4876.description: Balblair 18 Year Old is the third whisky in the Balblair Collection and has been matured in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in first-fill Spanish oak butts. The result is a charismatic single malt with a rich toffee and pear aroma, with a hint of warm spices and leather. The palate offers notes of ripe apricots and raisins balanced by toasted oak and vanilla custard, before a long, warming finish filled with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.name: Talisker 11 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.description: Talisker has more recently become a mainstay of the Diageo Special Releases, and this 2022 edition is continues the tweaking of the Talisker character. Along with the classic American-oak ex-bourbon casks, this also has some wine casks thrown into the mix, which add a subtle but intriguing extra bit of fruity complexity and spice.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3987.name: Collectivum XXVIII
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3987.description: The blend to end all blends? Collectivum XXVIII is a blend of all 28 operational single malt distilleries currently owned by Diageo – hence ‘XXVIII’ in the name, which is 28 in Roman numerals. This unique whisky delivers complex aromas and flavours: expect everything from richness to dryness, nuttiness to sweetness, chocolate to citrus zest. A well-balanced homage to the greatness of Scotch whisky distilleries.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5615.name: Talisker 2011
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5615.special: 8 Year Old Rum Finish Special Releases 2020
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5615.description: A very special Talisker, released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2020. This has been finished in pot-distilled Jamaican rum casks, adding extra layers of flavour to the distillery's classic salt-and-pepper maritime notes. Rich, sweet and very tasty.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6186.name: Oban 2008
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6186.description: Distilled in 2008, this 12-year-old Oban single malt has been matured in freshly-charred American oak casks, before being bottled as part of Diageo's 2021 Special Releases. Aromas of crispy seaweed, flaky sea salt, black pepper, light smoke, chilli sauce and olive oil fill the nose. The palate offers notes of lemon, oak spice, garden herbs, salty sea air and oily pepper that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6677.name: Caol Ila 2008
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6677.description: A 2008 Caol Ila single malt from The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. that was matured in a single ex-bourbon cask for 13 years, before being bottled in 2022 as part of its Cooper's Choice series. Aromas of salty sea breezes, warm tar, burnt heather and lemon zest fill the nose, complemented by notes of green apples, malted barley, vanilla, black pepper, peat smoke and tangy orange throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6756.name: Longmorn 1999
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6756.special: 22 Year Old Gleann Mor Rare Find
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6756.description: A 1999 Longmorn single malt from independent bottler Gleann Mor that was matured in a single cask for 22 years, before being bottled in 2022 as part of its Rare Finds series. Aromas of coconut, tropical fruits and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of blackcurrant, pears, peaches, vanilla custard and sweet exotic fruits throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6733.name: Glen Grant 1994
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6733.description: A 1994 Glen Grant single malt from independent bottler Hunter Laing that was matured in a refill barrel for 28 years, before being bottled in May 2022 as part of its Old & Rare series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6858.name: English Whisky Co. 15 Year Old Founders Private Cellar
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6858.description: A limited-edition English single malt from the English Whisky Co. that was matured in a single bespoke sherry cask from founder James Nelstrop's private cellar for 15 years, before being bottled in July 2022. The nose is dark and oily, filled with aromas of sticky dates, raisins and sultanas, complemented by notes of cherries, dark chocolate, figs, ginger and dried fruits throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6574.name: The English 2012
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6574.description: A smoky small-batch single malt from The English Whisky Company that was matured in virgin oak until February 2022 and released at the beginning of Spring. Aromas of wood fires, dates and caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of rhubarb and custard, oak spice and rich smoke throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5322.name: Cotswolds Peated Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5322.description: A rich and fruity English single malt from Cotswolds distillery, matured in an ex-peated whisky quarter cask, creating a delicate smokiness throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6591.name: The Lakes The Whiskymaker's Reserve No.5 Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6591.description: The fifth release of The Lakes Distillery Whiskymaker's Reserve single malt has been matured in a combination of oloroso sherry, Pedro Ximenez sherry and red wine casks, made with Spanish and American oak. Aromas of red apples, polished oak, chocolate and rich Devonshire cream fill the nose, complemented by notes of pecans, walnut, baklava, candied papaya, coffee, toasted brown sugar and clotted cream throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6292.name: Cotswolds Sherry Cask Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6292.description: A sherry cask matured English single malt from the Cotswolds Distillery that was aged in a combination of American and Spanish oak hogsheads and butts which have previously held either oloroso or Pedro Ximenez sherry. Aromas of brown sugar, cherry pie and roasted coffee beans fill the nose, complemented by notes of plums, chocolate, toasted almonds and peppery oak throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6661.name: Dartmoor Whisky Bourbon Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6661.description: A sweet and creamy English single malt from Dartmoor Whisky that was made using locally-produced barley and matured in an American white oak ex-bourbon cask. The nose is all about vanilla, complemented by notes of toffee, crème brûlée, marshmallow and honey throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6276.name: The Norfolk 9 Year Old Rye
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6276.description: A smooth Norfolk rye whisky from The English Whisky Company that has been matured in a combination of virgin oak and ex-bourbon casks. The palate offers notes of milk chocolate, orange zest, cinnamon, white pepper, lemon thyme and oily grain that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6205.name: East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6205.description: The 2021 release of East London Liquor Company's collaboration with Sonoma Distilling Co is a combination of London Rye Whisky and California Bourbon made with American corn, rye and wheat. Aromas of brandy-soaked cherries, peanut butter, chocolate, ice tea, apricots and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of fresh grass, honeysuckle, sweetcorn, leather and peanut butter throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6377.name: The English 2016
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6377.special: 4 Year Old Virgin Oak & Sherry Cask Matured
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6377.description: Bottled just shy of its fifth birthday, this release from Norfolk's English Whisky Co. has been aged in a combination of virgin oak and ex-sherry casks. Distilled in December 2016 and bottled in November 2021, it has notes of chocolate orange and dried fruit.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5148.name: East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5148.description: A collaboration between East London Liqueur Co. and Sonoma Distilling Company's Adam Spiegel, this London Rye whisky has been matured in a variety of casks, including ex-peated whisky casks and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of honey, brandy-soaked cherries, almond butter, hay and honeysuckle fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, dried apricots, candied cherries, coffee and porridge.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6301.name: The English Gently Smoked Sherry Cask 2012
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6301.description: The 2021-release of gently smoky sherry cask matured English single malt from The English Whisky Co. is a softly smoky whisky with a bright and fruity character. The palate offers notes of cherries, aniseed, liquorice, toffee, honey, cinnamon, toasted oak and aromatic peat smoke that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6460.name: The Lakes The Whiskymaker's Editions Mosaic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6460.description: A limited-edition release from The Lakes Distillery's Whiskymaker's Editions series, Mosaic offers a diversion from the distillery's usual sherry-forward style. Inspired by the Silk Road, Mosaic offers aromas of wood smoke, crunchy autumn leaves and soft oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple blossom, sweet cherries, aromatic oak and delicate spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6302.name: Cotswolds Founder's Choice
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6302.description: A cask-strength single malt from The Cotswolds Distillery, Founder's Choice is made with 100% locally-grown, floor-malted barley and is aged exclusively in STR ex-red wine casks – a favourite of the distillery's founder Daniel Szor. Aromas of dry hay, freshly-cut wood, dark chocolate, dried figs and plums in syrup fill the nose, complemented by notes of warm porridge, toast, butterscotch, dried fruit and fresh berries throughout the palate, with hints of roasted hazelnuts lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.name: The Lakes The Whiskymaker's Editions Infinity
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.description: A complex and mysterious limited-edition single malt from The Lakes distillery's Whiskymaker's Editions series, Infinity was matured in a combination of oloroso, Palo Cortado, fino and Manzanilla sherry casks until it was bottled in late 2021. The palate offers notes of polished oak, incense sticks, cocoa nibs, sea salt, toasted rye bread, dates, treacle, baking spices and forest fruits that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.name: Singleton of Glen Ord 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.description: A different take on The Singleton of Glen Ord 15 Year Old, released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2022. This starts its life the same as the regular release, but then spends a long eight years of secondary maturation in wine casks. The result is a soft and fruity whisky with extra layers of rich dark fruit and spice.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.name: Scapa 2003
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.special: 19 Year Old Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.description: A 2003 cask-strength Scapa single malt, bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. It was matured in first-fill American oak barrels for 19 years before bottling in August 2022. This is a rare whisky: one of the few official Scapa bottlings available, the first-ever shop-exclusive and it's bottled at cask strength. A fruity, sweet Orkney single malt, the palate offers notes of fresh apricots, orange marmalade and homemade fudge that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6845.name: Orkney 2006
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6845.description: A 2006 Orkney single malt from The Whisky Exchange that was made at a mystery distillery on Orkney and matured in a single barrel for 16 years, before being bottled in 2022. The palate offers notes of poached pears, cloves, milk chocolate, lime sweets, charred orange peel, smouldering logs and smoky leather that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.name: Strathisla 2007
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.special: 15 Year Old Exclusive to The Whisky Exchange
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6778.description: A 2007 Strathisla single malt, bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange. It was matured in first-fill American oak for 15 years and bottled at cask strength. We're particular please that we managed to source this whisky, the first shop-exclusive and a rare cask-strength official bottling of whisky from the distillery. It's packed with the distillery's trademark fruitiness, with softly spicy and toffee-forward flavours from the casks layered on top.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6346.name: Caol Ila 2010
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6346.special: 11 Year Old Sherry Cask The Whisky Exchange Exclusive
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6346.description: A 2010 Caol Ila single malt, bottled in September 2021 by Signatory Vintage exclusively for The Whisky Exchange, after 11 years in a single refill sherry butt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4805.name: Red Spot 15 Year Old Irish Whiskey
