https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4805.description: The third entry in the Spot range of single pot still whiskeys is a rich, spicy and enticing Irish whiskey, exploring the influence of sherry and Marsala casks. Matured for more than 15 years in ex-bourbon, -sherry and -Marsala casks, it combines ripe, dried and stewed fruit flavours with sweetness and spice.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2908.name: Redbreast 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2908.description: A sumptuous single pot still whiskey with a great degree of ageing, Redbreast 15 is richer, earthier and stronger than its 12 year old sibling. An essential part of any whiskey-drinker's education.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2971.name: Benromach 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2971.description: Introduced to the Benromach line-up in 2015, this lusciously rich Speyside single malt is a fruity, chocolatey and lightly smoky dram that will delight fans of traditional styles.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6454.name: Aberlour A'Bunadh Alba
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6454.description: A cask strength edition in Aberlour's A'Bunadh range, Alba refers to Quercus Alba, the variety of American white oak used to make the ex-bourbon barrels that this whisky was exclusively matured in. Aromas of peaches and cream, tropical fruits, sweet malt and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple and cinnamon pie, tropical fruits, creme Anglaise, autumn leaves and elegant flowers throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6814.name: Laphroaig 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6814.description: A rich, complex bourbon barrel matured whisky from Laphroaig, this is the 15th edition of the Islay distillery's ever-popular Cask Strength 10 Year Old single malt. Bottled in December 2021, aromas of oat biscuits, green oak, candle wax, vanilla cream, wood smoke, tobacco, nutmeg and old leather fill the nose, complemented by notes of charred wood, burnt marshmallows, sea salt, toffee, caramel waffles, white peppery, roasted coffee, cinnamon and vanilla fill throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6768.name: Ardmore 2009
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6768.description: A 2009 Ardmore single malt from independent bottler Watt Whisky that was matured in a barrel for 12 years, before being bottled in 2022 as part of Watt Whisky's eight release. The palate offers notes of lemon meringue pie, pistachios and soft smoke that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6804.name: Starward Tawny Cask 2018
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6804.description: A decadent 2018-vintage Australian single malt from Melbourne-based distillery Starward that was finished in Tawny fortified wine barrels from McLaren Vale and bottled in 2022 as part of its Projects series. Aromas of raisins, figs, toffee and dried fruit fill the nose, complemented by sweet caramel, rich dried fruits, brown sugar, tropical fruit, homemade panettone and baking spices throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9731.name: Glendronach 15 Year Old Revival
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9731.description: The revived Glendronach Revival: a whisky whose original incarnation was so popular that we drank all of it. It's back with a new recipe thanks to master blender Rachel Barrie, combining both oloroso and PX casks into a rich sherry-monster that's packed with spice and fruit.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5730.name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5730.description: A fruity Glenfarclas single malt bottled exclusively for The Whisky Exchange after 15 years in sherry-seasoned oak. The result is sweet aromas of crème brûlée, raisins, toffee and vanilla custard on the nose, complemented by notes of blackcurrant jam, liquorice, sticky ginger cake, fudge, fruitcake and speculoos biscuits.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3084.name: Aberfeldy 16 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3084.description: Aberfeldy 16 Year Old was released in 2015 as part of The Last Great Malts series. Matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this has lovely balance between sweetness and spiciness.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1099.name: Edradour 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1099.description: A special bottling of Edradour 12yo, named after Dougie Maclean's most famous song, Caledonia. This is the first in what will be an ongoing series from Edradour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4780.name: Deanston 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4780.description: Our Whisky of the Year for 2022, this 18-year-old Highland malt is matured entirely in first-fill Bourbon casks, dialling up Deanston’s trademark tropical fruit and honey character to eleven and reinforcing it with rich American oak notes of butter and vanilla. Fantastic stuff.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6759.name: Glenturret 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6759.description: The 2022-release of Glenturret 12 Year Old was matured in a combination of American and European oak casks and bottled in 2022. Aromas of caramelised apples, vanilla custard, creamy oak and baking spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of cherry pie, baked apples, cinnamon, vanilla and oak spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6498.name: Chivas Regal 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6498.description: Chivas Regal 18 Year Old is a premium aged mix of some of Scotland's finest whiskies with an higher-than-average proportion of malt and an extended ageing period producing a truly fine blend.

attributes.distiller: Chivas Regal 18 Year Old / Gift Box']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6784.name: Hatozaki 12 Year Old Umeshu Finish
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6784.description: A small-batch 12-year-old malt whisky from Hatozaki that was initially matured in American oak casks, before being finished for six months in specially-selected barrels that previously held Japanese Umeshu liqueur. The palate offers notes of honey, lychee, cherry blossom, lavender, vanilla and violets that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2377.name: Hakushu Distiller's Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2377.description: A green and crunchy entry in the Hakushu Range, combining whisky of a wide variety of ages, from across the range of casks used by the distillery to create a gently smoky dram, packed with fruity flavour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1013.name: Hibiki 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1013.description: Another hit for Suntory, this Hibiki 21 merited 93 points from Jim Murray in 2009, while Dr. Whisky called it 'Unbelievably balanced, and dangerously drinkable.'

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5091.name: Dalmore 35 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5091.description: The 2021-release of The Dalmore 35 Year Old single malt has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon barrels, Port pipes and Matusalem oloroso sherry casks, before being married in first-fill ex-bourbon barrels. Aromas of roasted coffee, liquorice, orange, Morello cherries and ginger fill the nose, complemented by notes of marmalade, ground cinnamon, chocolate cake, chestnuts, raisins, mango, plums and pineapple throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3938.name: Dalmore 40 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3938.description: The 2017 release of Dalmore 40 Year Old was aged in bourbon casks for around 30 years, then aged in oloroso-sherry butts for a further seven before being finished in first-fill bourbon barrels. The result is a whisky with notes of gingerbread, maple syrup, honey and brioche.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1856.name: Dalmore 50 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1856.description: Very similar in character to the Dalmore 50yrs in the crystal decanter (they are from the same batch of stock), this is an earlier presentation from the 1970s and is packaged in a smart black ceramic decanter. Dalmore ages better than perhaps any other Highland distillery, and gives Macallan a run for its money in the quality stakes, but stocks are always very low.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6579.name: Dalmore 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6579.description: Part of the 'Rare & Prestigious' range from Whyte & Mackay. This 1973 Dalmore was originally matured in American White Oak casks before a second maturation for several years in Cabernet Sauvignon casks from Ch. Haut-Marbuzet, a Cru Bourgeois claret from the St. Estephe appellation. This is being styled as 'The Ultimate Finish' and comes in a suitably smart presentation box.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5091.name: Dalmore 40 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5091.description: The 2019 bottling of Dalmore 40 Year Old single malt is a rich and fruity single malt. The palate is rich and full, notes of coffee, sultanas, dates, gingerbread and maple syrup mingling together before a finish full of blood orange and coconut notes.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8494.name: Dalmore 150th Anniversary Crystal
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8494.description: A decanter created in celebration of the 150th anniversary of Dalmore's 1839 founding. Made by Edinburgh Crystal and with a metal medallion engraved with the Dalmore stag crest and bottle number. We believe this contains a 30 year old malt and was only made for staff and is one of only 50 bottles.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6448.name: Dalmore 1966
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6448.description: For well over a century a variety of fine Dalmore single malts have been crafted by a small band of local stillmen. In particular, on 21st March 1966, Col. H. A. C. Mackenzie distilled and filled to cask what has now become the Dalmore 40 Year Old masterpiece.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6649.name: Dalmore 45 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6649.description: The 2022-release of The Dalmore 45 Year Old was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks, before being transferred to Graham's Port Colheita pipes for five years, and married in first-fill ex-bourbon casks before bottling. Aromas of toffee, treacle, Sanguinello blood oranges, almonds and coffee fill the nose, complemented by notes of red berries, liquorice, hazelnuts, sticky toffee pudding, bitter chocolate, green apples and Manuka honey throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1857.name: Dalmore 50 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1857.description: An amazing intensity of flavour, with truly profound depths, Dalmore 50 year old is an unforgettable experience. The astonishing range and concentration of aromas and flavours that assail the senses as one approaches this whisky are almost boundless, and remain utterly unique to Dalmore 50 year old. One thing is certain - it takes years to create a masterpiece, but only seconds to recognise it.

attributes.distiller: Dalmore 50 Year Old / Sherry Cask / Crystal Decanter']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3482.name: Dalmore 35 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3482.description: Dalmore 35 has been aged in three types of cask: a Matusalem sherry, a bourbon barrel and a colheita-port pipe. Presented in a Baccarat Crystal decanter, this is classic rich Dalmore with notes of coffee, treacle, banana and orange.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1418.name: Dalmore 1981
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1418.description: A very limited 1981 Dalmore, finished in cask that had previously held the fabulous Matusalem sweet oloroso sherry from Gonzalez Byass. There are just 497 bottles of this, and it should be fabulous.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1854.name: Dalmore 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1854.description: Distilled in 1966 and aged for 30 years in a sherry cask to celebrate the 300th Anniversary of Shephard Neame Brewery, established in 1698. This is extremely rare as it was for employees only and never sold in retail, an absolutely superb Dalmore, one of my favourites - Sukhinder Singh.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1851.name: Dalmore 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1851.description: A rather interesting release from Dalmore distillery. This whisky claims to have been distilled "prior to 1960", so we do not have an exact vintage. However, we do know that this has been matured for 25 years and was bottled sometime in the early to mid 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3020.name: Dalmore 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3020.description: The 2015 release of Dalmore 30 Year Old is limited to 888 bottles. Aged in oloroso-sherry butts, this has notes of Christmas cake, coffee, honey and spice.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1562.name: Dalmore 20 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1562.description: A delightful old bottling of Dalmore at 20 years old. This was bottled in the 1960s, when the distillery had just been purchased by Whyte & Mackay. Serge Valentin on whiskyfun.com gave it 93 points and commented it was sweet, fruity and full of secondary flavours.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6770.name: Dalmore 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6770.description: The 2022-edition of The Dalmore 30 Year Old single malt has been matured in American oak ex-bourbon barrels and finished in tawny port pipes which previously held Graham's 1982 Single Harvest Tawny Port. Aromas of juicy Victorian plums, sticky toffee apple, moist ginger bread, Morello cherries and warm brioche fill the nose, complemented by notes of Black Forest gateau, Maraschino cherries, freshly brewed Colombian coffee, soft chewy liquorice, Sanguinello blood oranges and dark chocolate throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2566.name: Dalmore 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2566.description: A very appealing 1960s Dalmore released by indie bottler Cadenhead in November 1978 at 15 years of age.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1852.name: Dalmore 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1852.description: A very special 1973 vintage whisky from Dalmore distillery, signed by master blender Richard Paterson. This whisky has been matured for 30 years and has spent time being finished in sherry casks which previously held Gonzalez Byass Sherry.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2854.name: Dalmore 20 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2854.description: A delightful old bottling of Dalmore at 20 years old. This was bottled in the 1970s, not long after the distillery had just been purchased by Whyte & Mackay.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2577.name: Dalmore 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2577.description: A 30 year old bottling of Dalmore, released as part of Whyte & Mackay's now-defunct Stillman's Dram series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1849.name: Dalmore 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1849.description: A marvellous old early 1970s bottle of Dalmore 12yo with a simply-designed black label and a cork stopper.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4079.name: Yamazaki Mizunara 18 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4079.description: An incredibly rare and sought-after release from pioneering Japanese distiller Yamazaki. Created by master blender Shinji Fukuyo using Yamazaki’s decades of experience with mizunara – Japanese oak – and whiskies from 18 to 50 years of age, this very limited release showcases the wood’s unique effect on maturing spirit. Layers of exotic spices and incense notes mingle with fruit: a masterclass in Japanese whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2922.name: Hakushu 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2922.description: A perennial favourite and a must-try for anyone interested in discovering Japanese whisky. Hakushu is owned by Suntory, founders of the first Japanese distillery, Yamazaki. The original Hakushu distillery was built in 1973, with another distillery building called Hakushu Higashi (east) added in 1981.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6330.name: Mortlach 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6330.description: A 25-year-old single malt from independent bottler Gordon & MacPhail, distilled at Mortlach distillery and bottled as part of its Distillery Labels series. Aromas of fruit cake, sherry-soaked raisins and baking spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of clove-studded orange, summer berries, autumnal spices, almonds and sherried fruit throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6834.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost and Rare Port Dundas
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6834.description: The fifth release of Johnnie Walker's limited-edition Ghost and Rare series celebrates Glasgow's famous Port Dundas grain distillery, that closed its doors and sired down its stills in 2010. Known for its distinctive sweet, fragrant character, Port Dundas was not only a blending powerhouse but also one of the world's most-famous grain whisky distillery, and Johnnie Walker master blender Dr Emma Walker has hand-picked whiskies that will complement and show off this ghost distillery's character. The creamy, woody notes of Port Dundas have been complemented by softly smoky, vanilla-forward whisky from ghost distillery Cambus, original stocks from Brora and fruity whiskies from five iconic distilleries.

attributes.distiller: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost and Rare Port Dundas']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4894.name: Port Askaig 28 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4894.description: Port Askaig 28 Year Old was bottled by Elixir Distillers, from a small, specially selected batch of refill American oak hogsheads. Complex, coastal and peaty, this Islay single malt has herbal aromas of mint, smoked tea leaves and pine, alongside almonds, tropical fruits and vanilla. The palate offers notes of orange peel, custard and cinnamon, alongside salty, savoury notes.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.name: Caperdonich 21 Year Old Peated
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.description: A fruity, smoky single malt from Caperdonich, matured in barrels for 21 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of soft peat, bonfire ash and juicy oranges fill the nose, complemented by notes of herbal tea leaves, cool mint and wisps of peat smoke throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6195.name: Bunnahabhain Aonadh 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6195.description: Bunnahabhain Aonadh 10 Year Old has been matured in a combination of sherry and port casks, creating a fruity, spicy dram. Aromas of vanilla, brandy butter, caramel, dark berries and oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, plums, blackberries, roasted walnuts, dark chocolate and a salty tang throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.name: Caperdonich 18 Year Old Peated
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5440.description: A bold and smoky peated single malt from Caperdonich, matured in barrels for 18 years before being bottled as part of the Secret Speyside Collection. Aromas of bonfire smoke, poached pears and hot tar fill the nose, complemented by notes of baked apple pie, smouldering driftwood, orange zest and aromatic smoke throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6373.name: Lagavulin 2006 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6373.description: A 2006 Distillers Edition Lagavulin single malt, matured in ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry casks until it was bottled in 2021. Aromas of bold peat, sweet vanilla, roasted malt and ashy smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of sea salt, coffee, vanilla, intense peat smoke and hints of green apple and lemon throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6446.name: Talisker 2011 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6446.description: A 2011 Talisker Distillers Edition single malt that was finished in Amoroso sherry cask before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of sultanas, rich malt and peppery oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of cocoa, crisp peat, savoury malt, juicy plums and cracked black pepper throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6035.name: Oban 2006 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6035.description: A 2006 Distillers Edition Oban single malt, finished in Montilla Fino sherry casks and bottled in 2020. Aromas of dates, sugared almonds, ginger, oak and waxy orange peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of chocolate digestives, ginger biscuits, pecans, salty sea breeze and juicy sultanas throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2387.name: The Irishman 12 Year Old Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2387.description: The Irishman 12 Year Old Single Malt is aged exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks. Limited to 6,000 bottles each year, this is malty and fruity.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6068.name: The Irishman 2004 Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6068.description: A 17-year-old Irish single malt whiskey from The Irishman, matured in first-fill sherry casks, creating aromas of dark chocolate, dried fruit and honey on the nose, complemented by notes of toasted oak, raisins, sherry, roasted hazelnuts and dark chocolate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6505.name: The Irishman The Harvest
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6505.description: Previously known as Founder's Reserve, The Harvest blended Irish whiskey from The Irishman is made with a combination of 70% single malt and 30% single pot still whiskey and matured in American oak ex-bourbon barrels. Aromas of white pepper, green apples, pears, zesty spices and citrus fill the nose, complemented by notes of ripe fruits, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, cracked peppercorns, nutmeg and clove throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6401.name: The Irishman Cask Strength
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6401.description: The 2021 release of The Irishman Cask Strength Irish whiskey has been matured in specially-selected American oak casks, creating aromas of candied oranges and cherries that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of clove, nutmeg, toasted hazelnuts and fresh berries that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6505.name: The Irishman Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6505.description: A triple-distilled Irish single malt whiskey from The Irishman that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks. Aromas of juicy peaches, dried apricot, tropical fruits, orange blossom and vanilla fudge fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, toasted almonds, honey, crunchy granola, digestive biscuits, rich malt and peppery oak spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6480.name: South Star Islay Single Malt 2013
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6480.description: A 2013-vintage Islay single malt from independent bottler South Star Spirits, made at a mystery distillery on the island and matured in a small batch of hogsheads for eight years, before being bottled in 2021. Rich, smoky aromas fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, sea salt, peat smoke, oak and ashy bonfires throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2038.name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2038.description: Rich and sherried 15yo malt from one of the best distilleries in Speyside. Aged for a little bit longer and bottled a little stronger for a more concentrated, richer flavour. As always, Glenfarclas remains one of the best-value malts on the market – a must for lovers of sherried whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1619.name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1619.description: Caol Ila 12 Year Old is of medium weight, but still packing plenty of potent phenols, this is a refined, powerful dram with a compensating oiliness. A balanced, peaty beauty..

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4022.name: Kilchoman Machir Bay
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4022.description: Kilchoman's ongoing Machir Bay is a vatting of whisky matured in first-fill bourbon casks for around six years, married and then finished in oloroso sherry butts before bottling.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1282.name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1282.description: A giant leap forward for Bunnahabhain 12yo, this edition was launched in summer 2010 with a jump in strength to 46.3% and a declaration of no chill-filtration and no added colouring. The producers deserve enormous credit for giving punters what they want without jacking up the price too much and we earnestly hope that this will be a massive success. Bravo!

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4935.name: Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban 14 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4935.description: A full-bodied, silky-smooth single malt from Glenmorangie, finished in a Quinta Ruban port cask, creating a rich chocolate flavour. Gentle aromas of Seville oranges and walnut build into rich dark chocolate, sandalwood and spicy pepper. The palate initially offers notes of mint chocolate, walnuts and orange develop into Turkish delight and summer flowers.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3844.name: 1792 Single Barrel
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3844.description: Occasionally, barrels destined for 1792 bourbon are found to be good enough to be bottled on their own. This single-barrel release is rich and sweet with notes of butterscotch, caramel, toffee and mixed fruit.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5036.name: Dunville's 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5036.description: Dunville's 12 Year Old has ben aged in Pedro-Ximenez casks and bottled at Echlinville Distillery. The result is a sweet and lightly spicy whiskey with notes of bubblegum, custard and green apples.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4588.name: Green Spot Chateau Montelena Finish
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4588.description: The Mitchell's Spot whiskeys have always had an affinity for wine, and this Green Spot shows that off even further. Rich and spicy triple-distilled pot-still whiskey from Midleton is initially aged in bourbon and sherry casks before being finished for 12 months in casks that used to hold rich red Zinfandel wine from the famed Chateau Montelena in California's Napa Valley. Montelena was bought by Irishman Jim Barrett in the 1970s, and this release celebrates the shared heritage of his wine and Midleton's fine whiskey. It's rich and spicy, with layers of marzipan and toasted oak on top of the pot-still fruit and weightiness.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4465.name: Green Spot 1991
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4465.special: 26 Year Old Marsala Cask TWE Exclusive
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4465.description: A very special bottling, selected by and exclusive to The Whisky Exchange: a single cask of 26-year-old Green Spot pot still whiskey, distilled at Midleton and filled into cask on 18 October 1991. It was initially matured in bourbon and sherry casks, before the spirit was reracked into a single Marsala butt for further maturation. The result brings together the fresh fruit flavours of bourbon-cask maturation with the richer dried fruit notes you get from sherry casks, and stirs them both together with fragrant Marsala and classic Irish pot-still fruit and spice.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3007.name: Green Spot Leoville Barton Bordeaux Finish
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3007.description: A special edition of Green Spot, this was aged initially in a combination of bourbon- and oloroso-sherry casks before being finished for up to two years in barriques from famed Bordeaux winery Château Léoville Barton. A sweet blend of orchard fruit and spicy flavours.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1523.name: Jameson Black Barrel
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1523.description: A special pot still whiskey-heavy version of Jameson. Black Barrel has lots of first-fill bourbon and sherry casks in the mix, giving it a much richer flavour than regular Jameson, with a strong sherried note.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/284/.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old DoubleWood
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/284/.description: One of the classic after-dinner malts, Balvenie Doublewood's extra complexity and richness are a result of a second maturation in fresh sherry casks. Great stuff.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/232/.name: Arran 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/232/.description: Arran 10yo is a medium-bodied, citrussy dram that shows an elegance and deftness of touch that belies the distillery's youth. Tasting the complexity and assurance of this youngster it is difficult to believe that the distillery only opened in 1995. A great achievement.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5120.name: Arran Sherry Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5120.description: Exclusively matured in sherry hogsheads from Jerez, Spain, Arran Sherry Cask is an elegant single malt with rich layers of fruit and spice. Aromas of ripe figs, black cherries, cinnamon, crystalised ginger and raisins fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of dark chocolate, figs, mandarins and baking spices.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3256.name: Kilchoman Sanaig
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3256.description: Originally released in France, Sanaig was given a wider release in 2016. Aged in a combination of oloroso-sherry and bourbon casks, this shows excellent balance between peat smoke and sweet citrus flavours.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5748.name: Ledaig Rioja Cask Finish
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5748.description: The first release in Tobermory distillery's Sinclair Series, this smoky Ledaig single malt has been made with heavily-peated barley and finished in hand-selected Rioja casks. Aromas of Turkish Delight, candied orange peel, leather, black pepper and dark chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of almond, raspberries, vanilla, cinnamon and freshly cut grass on the palate over rich waves of savoury peat smoke.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6754.name: Smokehead Unfiltered
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6754.description: A smoky, nutty Islay single malt from Smokehead, Unfiltered offers aromas of ginger, vanilla, thick smoke, burnt earth and rich stout that fill the nose. The palate holds notes of walnuts, almond flakes, dark chocolate, black smoke, pepper and earthy peat that linger in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6503.name: Bladnoch Alinta
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6503.description: A lowland peated single malt from Bladnoch distillery, Alinta takes its name from an indigenous Australian word, found in several native Southeast Australian languages, that means 'fire' and 'flames'. Matured in a combination of ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry and ex-bourbon casks, Alinta finds a great balance between aromas of sweet oak spice, heather and vanilla-tinged smoke on the nose and rich campfire smoke, toasted almonds, raisins, white chocolate and burning heather throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.name: Bunnahabhain Moine 2013
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.special: 7 Year Old Bordeaux Wine Cask Feis Ile 2021
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.description: A limited-edition 2013 Bunnahabhain Mòine single malt that was finished in ex-Bordeaux wine casks and bottled in 2020 at seven-years-old. Aromas of lightly-toasted oak, dark grapes, raspberries, blackberry jam and dry smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of grapes, peat smoke, cocoa, red chilli, brambles and raisins throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6056.name: Balvenie 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6056.description: A 21-year-old single malt from the Balvenie Stories range, inspired by the legend of Margaret Douglas, widow of the Eighth Earl of Douglas, who lived at Balvenie Castle and paid rent to King James II every year in the form of a single red rose. Finished in Australian Shiraz casks, Second Red Rose offers aromas of ripe fruits, earthy tobacco, fresh mango and oak spice on the nose, complemented by notes of blackberry, peach, cracked black pepper and oak throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6816.name: Mortlach
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6816.description: A very special Mortlach, released as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2022. This takes a left turn compared to most other Mortlach whiskies, which are traditionally aged in sherry casks, and looks at other wines. It was finished in red-muscat and tawny-port casks, and also has a little bit of virgin-oak-finished whisky in the mix. The result is big, rich and spicy, with layers of dark red fruit flavour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.name: Braeval 2000
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6382.description: A 2000 Braeval single malt from indie bottler Signatory Vintage, matured in a single refill sherry butt and bottled in August 2021.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5628.name: Braes Of Glenlivet 1979
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5628.special: 15 Year Old Sherry Cask Whyte & Whyte

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6662.name: Braeval 2002
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6662.description: A 2002 Braeval single malt from the Distillery Reserve Collection that was for 17 years, before being bottled in 2019.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5649.name: Strathisla 2003
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5649.description: A 16-year-old Strathisla single malt, matured in a second-fill butt for more than a decade and matured in May 2019.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6663.name: Glentauchers 2008
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6663.description: A 10-year-old Glentauchers single malt from The Distillery Reserve Collection, matured in a single first-fill barrel and bottled in June 2019.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6664.name: Allt-a-Bhainne 2005
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6664.description: A 2005 Allt-a-Bhainne single malt from the Chivas Brothers Distillery Reserve Collection that was matured in a second-fill barrel for 15 years, before being bottled in August 2020.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4964.name: Glen Scotia Victoriana
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4964.description: Glen Scotia Victoriana has been bottled at cask strength and finished in heavily-charred oak casks. Victoriana has notes of richly-spiced fruit, vanilla and oak throughout the palate, followed by a gently smoky finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6006.name: Mannochmore 2008
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6006.special: 13 Year Old Reserve Cask - Parcel No.7
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6006.description: A 2008 Mannochmore single malt that was matured in a batch of six hogsheads for more than 13 years, before being bottled by Elixir Distillers in 2021, as part of its Single Malts of Scotland Reserve Casks Parcel 7. Aromas of freshly-cut grass, caramel sauce, cinnamon-spiced apple strudel and tropical candied mango fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, vanilla beans, nutmeg, pear jam and buttery croissants throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3015.name: Glen Scotia 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3015.description: This single malt from Glen Scotia is matured in specially selection American oak ex-bourbon barrels for 15 years before bottling. This creates layers of ginger, vanilla, sea spray and baking spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6342.name: Tomintoul 2006
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6342.description: A 2006 Tomintoul single malt that was initally matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in ex-Port pipes, before being bottled at 15-years-old. Aromas of brambles, red cherry, toasted brioche and amoretti biscuits fill the nose, complemented by notes of cherry Bakewell, dark fruits, marzipan, clove and pink peppercorn throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2864.name: Tomintoul 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2864.description: This 25-year-old Tomintoul would have been distilled around 1990, when the distillery was owned by Whyte & Mackay. In the hands of Angus Dundee since 2000, the brand has been marketed as 'The Gentle Dram' and its reputation continues to grow.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6489.name: Tomintoul 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6489.description: A 1976 Tomintoul single malt that was matured in a single ex-Port pipe for 44 years, before being bottled in May 2021 as part of its Vintage Single Cask series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6518.name: Tomintoul 30 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6518.description: A full-bodied Tomintoul single malt that has spent three decades in a single ex-bourbon cask before being bottled in August 2021 in celebration of master distiller Robert Fleming's 30th anniversary as custodian of Tomintoul distillery. Aromas of tangy plum and candied orange peel, acacia honey, cinnamon pastries, stem ginger and citrus fill the nose, complemented by notes of poached pears, apple strudel, preserved lemons, toasted oak, sugared almonds and raisins throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3309.name: Tomintoul 1968
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3309.special: 43 Year Old Rare Old Gordon & MacPhail
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3309.description: A 1968 vintage Tomintoul, bottled in 2012 by Gordon & MacPhail for the Rare Old series. This spent more than four decades in cask before being bottled at natural cask strength of 45.5%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6489.name: Tomintoul 1976
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6489.description: A 1976 Tomintoul single malt that was matured in a single white port barrel for 44 years, before being bottled in August 2021 as part of its Vintage Single Cask series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6490.name: Tomintoul 1977
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6490.description: A 1977 Tomintoul single malt that was matured in an ex-Cognac cask and bottled at 44-years-old in August 2021, as part of its Vintage Single Cask series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5918.name: Tomintoul 2001
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5918.description: A 2001 vintage Tomintoul single malt, matured in a single ex-bourbon barrel for almost two decades, before being bottled in January 2020.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2483.name: Tomintoul 8 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2483.description: A rare old bottle of 8 year old whisky from Tomintoul which, we estimate, was bottled in the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1018.name: Tormore 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1018.description: An old bottling of Tormore at 10 years of age. A large proportion of Tormore's production is used for the Long John range of blended and blended malt whiskies. We estimate this was bottled in the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6411.name: Tormore 1995
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6411.description: A 1995 Tormore single malt from indie bottler Douglas Laing, matured in a single hogshead for quarter of a century before being bottled in December 2020 as part of its Xtra Old Particular series. Aromas of straw, gooseberry, green apples and candied nuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, oak, nutmeg, buttery biscuits, dried banana, lemon rind and orchard fruits throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1554.name: Tormore 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1554.description: A 1980s' distillery bottling of 10-year-old whisky from seldom-seen Tormore.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8631.name: Tormore 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8631.description: A discontinued old early 1990s bottle of Tormore 10yo selected for defunct Scottish off-license chain Victoria Wine.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2232.name: Glen Grant 20 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2232.description: One of Glen Grant's famous Director's Reserve bottlings - a whisky selected from the distillery director's own special stock. This one is a 20 year old and comes with an elegant glass decanter.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3424.name: Glen Grant 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3424.description: A 1973 vintage Glen Grant bottled at 25 years of age by Signatory. Distilled on 27 August , matured in a sherry butt and bottled at cask strength on 6 November 1998, part of a batch of 660 exclusively for World of Whiskies.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2261.name: Glen Grant 35 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2261.description: An old bottling of Glen Grant from independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail under the classic style label. This was matured for 35 years before being bottled, we estimate, in the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3286.name: Glenlivet 1966
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3286.description: A 1966 Glenlivet bottled by Gordon & MacPhail with the now traditional retro "Smith's" label in 2014.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2422.name: Glenlivet 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2422.description: A very special 25yo Glenlivet bottled for the Royal Wedding in 1981 (Charles & Di in case you missed it). They pulled out all the stops for this one - a tremendous bottling with a generous dollop of sherry in the mix.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2425.name: Glenlivet 34 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2425.description: A special 34 year old whisky from The Glenlivet, released in honour of their 1974 150th anniversary. Please note: this bottle contains sediment.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2575.name: Glen Ord 28 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2575.description: A top-quality cask-strength Glen Ord, with typical grassy, heathery and barley-sugar notes alongside summer fruits and well-integrated vanilla oak notes. Jim Murray gave this 90 points in the Whisky Bible, calling it 'Blisteringly beautiful'.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5709.name: The Singleton of Glen Ord 38 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5709.description: A limited-edition Singleton of Glen Ord single malt that was matured in a combination of refill sherry and ex-bourbon casks for almost four decades. Aromas of green apples and ripe pears, honeysuckle, cinnamon and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla fudge, cinnamon buns, peaches oak spice and crunchy apples throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5784.name: Glenordie 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5784.description: A bottle of 12-year-old whisky from Glen Ord, bottled by then distillery owner Dewars under the Glenordie name in the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5494.name: Glen Ord 1973
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5494.description: An official bottling of 1973 vintage Glen Ord as part of Diageo's Rare Malts series. During the time of distillation, there were two types of maltings in operation at the distillery - a Saladin box and a drum maltings.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6146.name: The Singleton of Glen Ord 39 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6146.description: A 39 Year Old single malt from The Singleton of Glen Ord, matured in a combination of European oak casks that had previously held port, red wine, Pedro Ximenez and oloroso sherry, which were later married in casks that previously held Bordeaux red wine casks. Mellow aromas of rich fruit cake, wine-soaked raisins, candied orange, toasted almonds, butterscotch and slightly burnt vanilla sponge cake fill the nose, complemented by notes of peppery spice, sticky dried fruits, plums, backing spice and sweet cherries throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2569.name: Glen Ord 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2569.description: An exuberantly spicy malt, with plenty of sherry influence, Glen Ord is a fine example of the Highland style and very good value for money. This bottling is now discontinued, to be replaced by Singleton of Glen Ord, so grab one while you can.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1758.name: Glen Ord 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1758.description: An old bottle of much-loved but now discontinued 12 year old Glen Ord. This is the litre version packaged with gift tube.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5493.name: Glen Ord 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5493.description: The old presentation of this much-loved Highlander.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2571.name: Glen Ord 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2571.description: A 1990s distillery bottling of 12 year old Glen Ord, more commonly known in the 2000s through its new Asian incarnation as Singleton of Glen Ord.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1302.name: Glenkinchie 1990
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1302.description: The second 20yo Glenkinchie bottled for Diageo's Special Releases is, like the first, a small batch from refill American oak casks. This is an equally enjoyable dram, in our opinion a bit better, although it definitely needs a drop of water to get going.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6445.name: Glenkinchie 2009 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6445.description: This 2021 Glenkinchie Distillers Edition was finished in Amontillado sherry casks after first being aged in recharred American oak casks. The secondary cask influence adds richer notes of nuts and spice to the characteristically light, fruity single malt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1882.name: Glenkinchie 15 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1882.description: A 15 year old bottling of Glenkinchie from the rarely seen Manager's Dram series. This was bottled for friends and employees of the distillery only in November 2010.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1192.name: Glenkinchie 1992
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1192.description: A single European oak cask of Glenkinchie 1992, bottled in 2009 as part of Diageo's Managers' Choice range. Along with the Dalwhinnie, this is one of the oldest bottles in the series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7032.name: Glenkinchie 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7032.description: Replacing the 10 year-old as the main expression of the Lowland style in the Classic Malts range, this Glenkinchie 12yo is a bit fuller and more complex.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2623.name: Glendronach 12 Year Old Original
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2623.description: A dense, heavily-sherried dram from a distillery now producing again after a six-year layoff. A malt best suited to after-dinner sipping.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2159.name: Bruichladdich Classic Laddie
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2159.description: Bruichladdich's Scottish Barley is made entirely from Scottish-grown barley, trickle distilled and then matured in American oak. The distillery class it as their signature bottling.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4396.name: Port Charlotte 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4396.description: Port Charlotte's long-awaited 10 year old, rich and smoky whisky made by the independently minded folks at Bruichladdich distillery on Islay. PC, as it's known to its friends, is heavily peated to 40ppm, putting it up with Islay's other heavy hitters. The resulting whisky is big and peaty with a maritime tang – the Bruichladdich team would claim that it's because their warehouses are so close to the sea, we're still undecided. In the end, the most important thing is the taste: it's rather good.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.name: Lagavulin 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.description: The 21st release of Lagavulin 12 Year Old as part of the Diageo Special Releases, and a whisky that continues a long and rightfully praised heritage. This year, a couple of extra components separate this from the pack. Firstly, the blending team selected extra smoky casks of whisky – they measure the phenol levels whenever a cask is filled, so can pick out extra-peaty whiskies if they need them. And secondly, they added some new-oak-finished whisky to the mix, adding extra layers of spice to an already big and smoky dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6819.name: Dalmore 2007
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6819.description: The Dalmore Vintages series combines the finest casks from a single year to create a single malt that embodies the distillery's character and showcases the skill of its whisky-makers. The second release of whisky in this series includes this 2007 Dalmore that began its life in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels and was transferred into a combination of Matusalem, Amoroso and Apostoles sherry casks, and Marsala wine casks, before being married together and bottled in 2022. Aromas of freshly-baked brioche, ginger cake and fondant icing fill the nose, complemented by notes of orange blossom, mandarin, cinnamon, clove, ginger snaps and sugar-dusted pastries throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.name: Oban 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6862.description: New Oban bottlings don't come along very long and this release as part of the Diageo Special Releases 2022 is a bit different to most. Matured initially in refill and new-American-oak casks, it is then further aged in amontillado sherry casks. The result is an elegant sherry-forward, dried and fresh fruit layer that complements Oban's orangey distillery character.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4133.name: Oban Bicentenary
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4133.description: A legendary bottling of 16yo sherried Oban, bottled at its remarkable cask strength of 64% under the Managers Dram label for UDV staff only to celebrate the distillery's bicentenary in 1994.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6445.name: Oban 2007 Distillers Edition
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6445.description: A 2007 Oban Distillers Edition single malt that was finished in Montilla Fino sherry casks before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of oranges, salty sea spray, grapes and smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit, malt biscuits, Jamaican coffee and oak throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/552/.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/552/.description: Johnnie Walker's most prestigious whisky. Probably THE most famous super-premium blend, made up of the finest old-aged malt and grain whiskies. The Cristal of the blended whisky world. Blue Label’s bold, multi-layered palate and silky delivery ensure that it sits unchallenged at the top of the Johnnie Walker pile.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3302.name: Kavalan Sherry Oak
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3302.description: A 2016 addition to Kavalan's core range, Sherry Oak uses the same casks that are normally reserved for the cask-strength Solist releases, but diluted to 46% using Kavalan spring water. Sweet and oily with notes of dried fruit, dark chocolate, pepper and raisins.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/629/.name: Royal Salute 21 Year Old Signature Blend
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/629/.description: One of the jewels in the Chivas crown, Royal Salute was created to celebrate the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. This 21 Year Old is a robust and sophisticated whisky, with fruity aromas and delicate floral spices. It is presented in a unique flagon, painted with a sapphire glaze reminiscent of the gems set within the Imperial State Crown.

attributes.distiller: Royal Salute 21 Year Old Signature Blend']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9241.name: Royal Salute 50 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9241.description: Royal Salute 50 year old is a blend of robust and powerful whiskies each matured in oak casks for a minimum of 50 years, resulting in a deep and sumptuous whisky.

attributes.distiller: Royal Salute 50 Year Old / Coronation Cask']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/632/.name: Royal Salute 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/632/.special: Royal Wedding Crown Prince of Japan
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/632/.description: This limited edition 25-year-old Royal Salute was bottled in 1993 to celebrate the marriage of Naruhito, Crown Prince of Japan, to Masaka Owada on 9 June that year.

attributes.distiller: Royal Salute 25 Year Old / Royal Wedding Crown Prince of Japan']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4920.name: Royal Salute 52 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4920.description: A limited-edition 52-year-old blended whisky from Royal Salute that has been finished in a single cask for 14 years, before being bottled as part of the Time Series. Intensely fruity aromas of ripe plums, toffee apples and chocolate-covered hazelnuts fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet marmalade, ginger and cloves, with hints of pears in syrup and liquorice that linger in the finish.

attributes.distiller: Royal Salute 52 Year Old / Time Series']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6350.name: Kavalan Solist Fino Sherry Cask #007A
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6350.description: A 2010 Kavalan Solist Taiwanese single malt that has been matured in a single Fino sherry cask. Lighter than other styles of sherry, this cask has imparted layers of juicy fruit and soft spices throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6420.name: Kavalan Triple Sherry Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6420.description: A rich, sweet Taiwanese single malt from Kavalan Distillery that has been matured in a combination of oloroso, Pedro Ximenex and Moscatel sherry casks, adding layers of dried fruit and nuts to Kavalan's classic tropical character. Aromas of summer berries, dried fruit, grapes, orange, chocolate brownies and toffee fill the nose, complemented by notes of caramel, honey, candied mango, cinnamon, raisins and dates throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4530.name: Mortlach 16 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4530.description: A rich and sherried expression from Mortlach that's will always be compared to the fan-favourite 16-year-old Flora & Fauna bottling. This is more balanced than that discontinued dram, with a mix of first-fill and refill sherry casks giving a wider range of sherry-cask character, from rich and dark dried fruit to plump and juicy berries.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4530.name: Mortlach 20 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4530.description: The elegant oldie in the Mortlach range, channeling The Beast of Dufftown (the distillery's nickname) into a more refined form. Matured solely in sherry casks, the whisky has been crafted to match rich and dark sherry character against old, refined oaky notes. It's one to take time with, well-balanced and complex, with much more going on than you might expect.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6130.name: Singleton of Dufftown 21 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6130.description: A sweet and citrus-forward single malt from Dufftown distillery. Matured in a combination of American and European oak casks, this is a richly honeyed dram filled with aromas of ginger, oranges and crunchy red apples that give way to a palate of stewed fruit, treacle toffee and berries.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6130.name: Singleton of Dufftown 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6130.description: A spicy, sweet single malt from Singleton of Dufftown, matured for 25 years in a combination of American and European oak casks. Aromas of tropical fruit, baking spices and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger, pears, pineapple, passionfruit and apple throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6722.name: Singleton of Dufftown 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6722.description: A relaunched Singleton, this time from Dufftown, to replace the now-defunct Singleton of Auchroisk. This smooth, mellow dram is designed to attract new drinkers to the malt category.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1727.name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1727.description: Johnnie Walker Gold Label was relaunched in 2012. Built around a core of single malt whisky from Clynelish, the Gold Label Reserve is a great addition to the line-up from master blender Jim Beveridge.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9372.name: Amrut Single Malt
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9372.description: Amrut's flagship Indian single malt, showing their signature character of spice, fruit and honey. Bottled at 46%, it has the depth of flavour needed to properly showcase the distillery. The original Indian single malt and, dare we say it, maybe the best?

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4557.name: Kavalan Distillery Select No.1
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4557.description: An entry-level release from award-winning Taiwanese distillery Kavalan, celebrating the craftsmanship of Master Blender Ian Chang. Aged in refill casks, Distillery Select captures the fruity, tropical character that Kavalan has become known for, whilst also displaying a refined balance from its maturation in the tropical temperatures of Taiwan. The palate is full of notes of tropical fruits and chocolate that mingle with toffee apples, salted-caramel and vanilla. The finish is smooth and fruity, full of pineapple and mango notes, and sweet, tropical spices.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4782.name: Singleton Glendullan Reserve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4782.description: The ancestral home of House Tully, Riverrun, sits at the junction of the Red Fork of the Trident and the Tumblestone River. The ruling Lord of the Riverlands, House Tully embodies the power and ferocity of the rivers it sits between. Using the power found in their positioning, House Tully forged strong alliances and built a history of honour, family and duty. Built along the banks of the River Fiddich, Glendullan Distillery originally relied on the waters it lay beside, using a water wheel to power the entire distillery. Like the Tullys themselves, this single malt can benefit from a splash of water, opening up flavours of green apple, honey and sweet vanilla.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4689.name: Johnnie Walker White Walker
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4689.description: A brand-new, limited-edition blend from Johnnie Walker inspired by Game of Thrones, this is a light and fruity whisky designed to be sipped straight from the freezer and allowed to develop as it warms. With notes of vanilla and fresh fruit, this is the perfect dram for both Game of Thrones fans and fledgling whisky enthusiasts.

attributes.distiller: Johnnie Walker White Walker / Game of Thrones Whisky']

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.name: Mortlach 2009
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.description: A 2009 Mortlach single malt from independent bottler Signatory Vintage that was matured in a handful of hogsheads for 12 years, before being bottled in April 2022 as part of its Un-Chillfiltered Collection.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3345.name: Linkwood 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3345.description: 'Rounded yet delicate. Apples again, tingly spiciness. Fills and perfumes the mouth. Delicious…a classic example of a relatively light and fragrant whisky that has real complexity and a gorgeous feel. 8/10' Dave Broom, Whisky Magazine, Nov 2002

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3991.name: Ardbeg An Oa
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3991.description: The first addition to Ardbeg's ongoing range for a decade when introduced in 2017, An Oa is a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2036.name: Glenfarclas 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2036.description: One up from their standard 10-year-old bottling, the 12 Year Old has two more years in the cask and is a step closer to the sherry-heavy older expressions.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/383/.name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/383/.description: A great, but sadly neglected, Highlander, Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. This expression has always tended towards the chunky, sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1863.name: Dailuaine 16 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1863.description: A delicious bottling from Dailuaine. Big, rich, sweet and smoky, with a very smooth mouthfeel and plenty of fruits and spices.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1998.name: Talisker Port Ruighe
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1998.description: An early 2013 addition to Talisker's range, taking their classic Skye whisky and finishing it in ruby port casks, rounding the edges and bringing in rich, fruity sweetness.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5830.name: Aberlour 14 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5830.description: A 14-year-old single malt from Aberlour, matured in a combination of oloroso sherry casks and first-fill American oak casks. The result is aromas of cloves, cardamom, toffee, milk chocolate and orange zest on the nose, complemented by notes of black cherries, mocha coffee and fresh mint throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2432.name: Tincup American Whiskey
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2432.description: Tincup American Whiskey is the brainchild of Colorado-based Jess Graber. A distiller as a hobby for 30 years, he turned full-time in 2004. A high rye whiskey, made with a bourbon-style profile but more powerful and spicier, the cap also works as a cup.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6417.name: Black Velvet Canadian Whisky
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6417.description: A very approachable blend of fine whiskies, Black Velvet is as smooth as the name would suggest and slips down almost alarmingly easily.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6416.name: Canadian Club
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6416.description: A giant of Canadian whisky, created in 1858 and spending six long years in oak before bottling for the smoothest possible flavour.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2554.name: Haig Club
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2554.description: David Beckham has made his mark in the world of whisky with the launch of Haig Club. A light and sweet grain whisky, Haig Club is aimed at drinkers who have yet to be won over by whisky’s charms. Named after John Haig, the founder of Cameronbridge distillery (where the whisky is made), Haig Club is superb over ice, in long drinks or in short cocktails – it’s an easy-drinking dram that will win anyone over.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3428.name: Haig Club Clubman
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3428.description: The second release from the brand part-owned by David Beckham, Haig Club Clubman is the entry-level bottling. Aged entirely in bourbon casks which give sweetness as well as enticing vanilla and coconut notes, this is a superb alternative to Jack Daniel's with cola.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2913.name: Glendalough Double Barrel Single Grain
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2913.description: Glendalough Double Barrel is a single grain Irish whiskey, aged in a combination of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks. Sweet and creamy, with butterscotch and honey from the American oak and dried fruit from the Spanish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6737.name: Teeling Whiskey Ginger Beer Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6737.description: A sweet and spicy small-batch single malt Irish whiskey that has been finished in ex-ginger beer casks from Umbrella London. The casks were hand-selected by Teeling master distiller Alex Chasko and sent to Umbrella London where they held its fiery ginger beer for two years, before finding their way back to Teeling. Aromas of creamy vanilla, spicy ginger and fresh citrus fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet malt, sticky molasses, fresh ginger, apples, oranges and peppery oak spice throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5610.name: Benriach The Smoky Twelve
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5610.description: A whisky that focuses on the richer side of Benriach's spirit, as well as it's darker smokier side. Aged for 12 years in a combination of bourbon, sherry and marsala casks, the peat smoke is complimented by dried fruit and vanilla from the bourbon and sherry casks, and rich, sweet fruit from the marsala.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2966.name: Port Askaig 100° Proof
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2966.description: 100° Proof is a punchy Islay single malt from Port Askaig. With notes of sweet fruit, peat smoke and minerality, this is a benchmark Islay whisky and a great everyday peaty dram at this price.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1629.name: Caol Ila Moch
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1629.description: Taking its name from the Gaelic for ‘dawn’, Moch is a wonderful newcomer from Caol Ila and is a must-try for fans of this outstanding distillery. Lighter in style than the standard 12yo expression, Moch is a fantastic easy-drinking dram.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/269/.name: Auchroisk 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/269/.description: The Flora and Fauna release of 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1089.name: Benromach 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1089.description: A smart packaging job for this distillery-bottled expression of Benromach 10yo, which has been a big hit since its introduction in late 2009. Well done to G&M for making the standard release strength 43%.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5450.name: Ardbeg Wee Beastie
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5450.description: An untamed young single malt from Ardbeg, Wee Beastie has spent five years in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks before being unleashed. Fresh, herbal aromas of pear, cracked black pepper, pine needles, vanilla and honey-glazed ham mingle on the nose with aniseed, green apple, leather and coffee. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, hot tar, smoked bacon, aniseed and eucalyptus that liner in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9141.name: Deanston 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/9141.description: Deanston's single malt, famous as the whisky used in the much-missed Wallace whisky liqueur. Trivia snitched from the Malt Whisky Yearbook: Deanston is the only distillery in Scotland that is self-sustaining for electricity, being equipped with a dam and a turbine.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.name: Deanston 2007
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.special: 12 Year Old Calvados Cask Distillery Exclusive
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6775.description: A 2007 Deanston single malt that was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in ex-Calvados casks for two years. Aromas of crisp red apples, sweet malt, blossom honey and green apple peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon peel, orange zest, green apples, honey and sweet flowers throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.name: Bruichladdich Bere Barley 2012
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6801.description: The 2012 Bere Barley single malt from Bruichladdich is made using this ancient grain variety that the distillery has been working with the University of the Highlands and Islands since 2005 to reintroduce to the whisky industry. Matured for a decade in first-fill ex-bourbon casks it offers aromas of lime zest, creamy vanilla, green apples and honeysuckle that fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet cereals, apple crumble, freshly-baked scones, peaches and heather honey on the palate, with sticky gingerbread, milk chocolate and marzipan lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6782.name: Manly Spirits Coastal Stone Bourbon Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6782.description: A mellow and sweet Australian single malt from the first wave of whiskies in Manly Spirits' Element Series that was matured in ex-Kentucky bourbon casks. Aromas of vanilla, green apples, pears and buttered caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of warm honey, baked pears, caramelised apple, leather, oak and baking spices throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6769.name: Blair Athol 2008
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6769.description: A 2008 Blair Athol single malt from independent bottler Watt Whisky's eight wave of bottles that was matured in a single hogshead and rested in a red wine barrique for 16 months, before being bottled in 2022. This whisky has a sweet character with rich undertones, offering notes of strawberries, jelly sweets and cured meats throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6647.name: Cotswolds Bourbon Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6647.description: An English single malt from Cotswolds Distillery's Cask Expressions Collection that was matured exclusively in specially-selected first-fill ex-Bourbon barrels. Aromas of oaky vanilla, custard and sweet malt fill the nose, complemented by notes of raisins, caramelised figs, vanilla, earthy oak and sweet honey throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6232.name: Matsui Mizunara
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6232.description: A Matsui Japanese single malt from Kurayoshi distillery that has been matured in rare Japanese mizunara oak casks and features Katsushika Hokusai's Thirty Six Views of Mount Fuji. Aromas of cherry blossom, vanilla, baking spices and coconut cream fill the nose, complemented by notes of oak, cinnamon, ginger, toffee, caramel and tobacco throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5531.name: Macallan 15 Year Old Double Cask
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5531.description: Macallan is known for ageing its whiskies in sherry casks and the Double Cask range, of which this 15 year old single malt is a part, explores what happens when whisky aged in two types of sherry-seasoned oak is combined. Matured in both European and American oak casks, this smooth single malt has notes of dried fruits, orange zest, melted chocolate, oak spice and honey.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6448.name: Balvenie 16 Year Old French Oak
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6448.description: A 16-year-old single malt from Balvenie's Cask Finishes range that was initially matured in American oak casks, before being finished in French oak Pineau des Charentes casks. Aromas of lotus blossom, geranium, green apple skin and spring meadows fill the nose, complemented by notes of lemon rind, grapefruit, ginger, vanilla, honey and candied fruit throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1969.name: Balvenie 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1969.description: A litre bottle of the now-discontinued Founder's Reserve, for many years the go to bottle in the Balvenie range. A great example of the distillery's famed honeyed whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/288/.name: Balvenie 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/288/.description: A limited release Balvenie produced from a batch of 79 casks. The whisky was matured for a total of 17 years, with the final period being spent in new (virgin) American white oak casks.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8933.name: Balvenie 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8933.description: A 17yo Balvenie finished in a Jamaican rum cask, likely to appeal to fans of the successful 14yo Rum Wood expression released, er, three years previously.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1085.name: Balvenie 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1085.description: A recent addition to Balvenie's tremendously successful releases of finished 17yo's, this has been finished in Madeira wine casks for a delicious combination of sweetness, spice and dry oak.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2668.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2668.description: A very desirable bottle of Balvenie Classic, rare because it has a 12 year-old age statement, whereas most bottles we've seen are either 18 year-old or no-age-statement. Presented in the trademark bottle, we estimate this dates from the 1980s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/278/.name: Balvenie 6 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/278/.description: An old independent release of Balvenie whisky. Bottled sometime in the 1980s, after 6 years of maturation. Apparently, this whisky has been made "Specially for Ladies".

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8084.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/8084.description: A very desirable bottle of Balvenie Classic, rare because it has a 12 year-old age statement, whereas most bottles we've seen are either 18 year-old or no-age-statement.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2223.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2223.description: A very desirable bottle of Balvenie Classic, rare because it has a 12 year-old age statement, whereas most bottles we've seen are either 18 year-old or no-age-statement.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/289/.name: Balvenie 18 Year Old Classic
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/289/.description: A flat bottle of Balvenie Classic from the 1980s. This bottling states its age of 18 years on the wax seal at the base of the neck. This is one of the rarer versions of these very collectable Balvenies.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6031.name: Balvenie 25 Year Old Rare Marriages
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6031.description: A 25-year-old single malt from Balvenie's Rare Marriages series, matured exclusively in European and American oak casks and married in a tun to create a fruity, elegant whisky. Aromas of autumn fruits, runny honey, crystalised ginger and oaky spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of toasted marshmallows, apple tart, cinnamon and fruit salad throughout the palate.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1682.name: Balvenie 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1682.description: An old bottle of Balvenie Founder's Reserve. This particular range has been discontinued for sometime now, and is becoming a bit of a collectors item.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7475.name: Balvenie 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7475.description: An old release of Balvenie 10 year old Founder's Reserve whisky. This is presented in interestingly shaped bottle. We usually see this sort of bottle used for Cognacs, but this is a welcome change. We would estimate that this was bottled sometime in the 1990s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/282/.name: Balvenie 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/282/.description: Another very enjoyable sherried Speysider from William Grant's (owner of Glenfiddich). Perfect as an introduction to the delights of single malt whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2459.name: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2459.description: A special bottling of Glenmorangie to commemorate our progression into the 21st century, this is made up of only whisky from first fill casks, giving a more fuller flavoured whisky than the regular 12 year old. Highly rated and increasingly rare.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2507.name: Glenmorangie Traditional
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2507.description: A litre bottle of Glenmorangie bottled with the minimum amount of fuss - unchillfiltered, undiluted and ready for drinking. A bit of water really helps the flavours on this one, but the higher strength gives you the choice as to how much.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2623.name: Glenmorangie 1992
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2623.description: A special bottling of 10-year-old Glenmorangie to celebrate ten years of successful partnership between Bacardi-Martini and Glenmorangie in the UK. Distilled in 1992, it was aged in cask 1285, yielding 249 bottles.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1895.name: Glenmorangie 1993 Ealanta
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1895.description: The 2013 release in Glenmorangie's annual Private Edition series of small batch wood experiments, Ealanta differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured (rather than finished) in its designer casks, which in this instance are made from heavily toasted new white oak.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2259.name: Glenmorangie Port Wood
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2259.description: This whisky has been matured for at least 12 years in American Oak Casks then finished in port pipes for a few years longer. This is the first release of the Port Wood which was at the higher strength of 46.5%, much bigger, bolder and a damn good whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6780.name: Glenmorangie Grand Vintage 1995
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/6780.description: The fifth installation in Glenmorangie's Grand Vintage Collection was distilled in 1995 and initially matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and oloroso sherry casks, before being finished in Margaux red wine casks and bottled in 2019. Aromas of buttery popcorn, toffee apples, nutmeg, freshly-baked bread, cinnamon, clove, milk chocolate and honey-drizzled apricots fill the nose, complemented by notes of black pepper, clove, mint, dark chocolate, toffee apples, red berry and pear crumble, sherbet lemons and orange zest throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1652.name: Glenmorangie 10 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1652.description: An old 10 year old Whisky from Glenmorangie. Glenmorangie is one of the most known Whiskies in the world, and their entry level 10 year old can be found in almost any shop or supermarket. This older bottle, on the other hand, is something quite special. We estimate that this bottle is from sometime in the 1960s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2490.name: Glenmorangie 1988
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2490.description: This is a rarely-seen bottling of Glenmorangie. Distilled in 1988 it was aged full term in a Madeira cask for 15 years, producing 856 bottles in 2003.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1719.name: Glenmorangie 1974
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1719.description: A 1974 vintage Glenmorangie bottled in 2000, specially for the duty free market. The best selling malt in the UK when it was bottled, this was handcrafted by the sixteen men of Tain (the distillery famously only uses 16 staff in the production process).

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2486.name: Glenmorangie 1983
