https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2486.description: A cask strength bottling by Glenmorangie as part of their Manager's Choice range. 1983 vintage whisky specially selected by the distillery manager and released in a numbered bottle.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2506.name: Glenmorangie
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2506.description: A very rare old bottling commemorating the Glenmorangie company's last Christmas at their old Leith headquarters.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5783.name: Glenmorangie 1987
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/5783.description: A snazzy bottling of 1987 vintage Glenmorangie with a fancy box and some time finishing in casks that previously held red wine from Margaux, a winegrowing region (and AOC) in Bordeaux, France. A must for collectors of Glenmorangie.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2467.name: Glenmorangie 1963
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2467.description: Another supremely contemplative malt that demands time and concentration – the first Glenmorangie to carry a vintage statement and the first to talk about a 'finish'. This bottling is from bourbon casks that were re-racked into Oloroso sherry casks for the final stages of maturation. One of the most difficult-to-find Glenmorangies.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2479.name: Glenmorangie 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2479.description: Legendary bottling from around the turn of the millennium. A truly beautiful 'Morangie.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2476.name: Glenmorangie 1975
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2476.description: A 1975 vintage Glenmorangie, bottled in 2003. The whisky spent at least its last 4 years of maturation in casks that previously held Hermitage red wine.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2813.name: Glendronach 1971
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2813.description: The oldest ever release in Glendronach's single casks series, this 1971 vintage was matured in a single Pedro Ximenez puncheon for 43 years, yielding 523 bottles in November 2014.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2633.name: Glendronach 150th Anniversary
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2633.description: A rare limited bottling of Glendronach, bottled to celebrate its 150th anniversary in 1976.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2381.name: Ballantine's 40 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2381.description: An exceptionally limited release (just 100 bottles each year) of 40 year old blended whisky from Ballantine's. Each bottle is hand numbered – an incredibly complex whisky.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2081.name: Ardbeg 1974
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2081.description: A bottling of Ardbeg from their exceptional 1974 vintage by independent bottlers Gordon & Macphail as part of their Connoisseurs Choice series. Considered to be the last vintage of true old peaty Ardbeg, bottlings from 1974 are always popular with collectors.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4222.name: Ardbeg 1974
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/4222.description: A mid-1990s bottle of Ardbeg from Direct Wines' First Cask range. This was distilled in 1974, one of Ardbeg's most lauded vintages. Aged for 19 years, this is a snapshot of the distillery at its finest.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/102/.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/102/.description: Supposedly the product of a mistake when the bottling strength was reduced to 42.4% instead of 43%, this very rare Ardbeg was bottled separately from the rest of the 1999 release and sold without a box.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/109/.name: Ardbeg 25 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/109/.description: At 25 years old this whisky embodies the richness, depth and sweetness of all Ardbegs. Light gold in colour and powerful in character. A phenomenal, much-sought-after bottling of a really outstanding malt.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1359.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1359.description: A 1990s bottling of Ardbeg 1978 from Gordon & Macphail's Connoisseurs Choice series, with the old Map Label presentation.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3191.name: Ardbeg 1978
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/3191.description: Bottled in 2005, this is an Ardbeg form the legendary 1978 vintage released at more than 25 years of age by indie bottler Gordon & MacPhail as part of the Connoisseurs Choice series.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1217.name: Ardbeggeddon 1972
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1217.description: A very special Ardbeg 1972, bottled from a single sherry cask to commemorate the Plowed Society's Ardbegeddon gathering in Las Vegas in 2002. A legendary bottling that won huge critical acclaim on release and remains highly sought-after.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2839.name: Bowmore 8 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2839.description: An old bottling of 8-year-old Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/107/.name: Ardbeg 1998
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/107/.description: The second release in Ardbeg's journey to the new 10yo, Still Young was released in 2006 and continued the successful 'path to peaty maturity' as the marketing types called it. A refreshing dram with great intensity.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2028.name: Ardbeg 1999 Galileo
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2028.description: A boisterous lad bottled at 49%, this Galileo-themed release from this Islay favourite sharpens typical Ardbeg peat smoke to a point, before shooting it through with sharp tropical fruit notes – sweet pineapple and earthy coconut – gifts from maturation in ex-Marsala wine casks. Originally released in 2012 to commemorate the distillery sending whisky to mature in space.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.name: Ardbeg Supernova
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1202.description: This is the 2010 version of Ardbeg Supernova, and no doubt will be hoping to follow on from the success of last year's edition, which scooped Scotch Whisky of the Year from Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2010.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/73/a.name: Ardbeg 17 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/73/a.description: A tad less peaty than early bottlings, the classic Ardbeg 17yo is still a great whisky, but is sadly becoming very thin on the ground as demand increases and supply runs low - it's now a good few years since owners Glenmorangie discontinued it. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1792.name: Ardbeg 1999 Galileo
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/1792.description: One of 2012's most hotly-anticipated releases, Ardbeg Galileo is made up from casks distilled in 1999, some of which spent their full term of maturation in casks that previously held Marsala wine, imparting sweet tropical fruit flavours to the mix. Galileo's concept is in celebration of the well-publicised experiment whereby small quantities of Ardbeg were sent into space at the end of 2011 to see how they mature in zero gravity.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7934.name: Ardbeg 1998
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/7934.description: Renaissance is the final instalment in a quartet of whiskies bottled to mark Ardbeg’s resurrection and subsequent return to form after being purchased and re-opened in 1997, following a six-year hibernation. The first ten-year-old bottling of the distillery’s ‘new’ spirit, this is as potent an expression of Ardbeg whisky as you’re likely to find – a must for collectors and connoisseurs.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2550.name: Bowmore 8 Year Old
https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/2550.description: An old litre bottling of 8-year-old Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

https://www.thewhiskyexchange.com/p/894/.name: Bowmore 1968
